jobTitle: Associate Director of Sales Operations - Americas
jobDescription: As the Associate Director of Sales Operations - Americas at IDEXX, you will be responsible for the strategic development of sales territories, sales goals methodology, sales incentive compensation plans and functional ownership of Anaplan, our Incentive Compensation system. In addition, you will be responsible for leading our Sales Support Organization(North America & Brazil) which assists the field sales team in executing non-standard sales proposals, deal shaping, contract management and assessment of competitive trends in the industry. In This Role You will work closely with the Senior Commercial Leadership team (Senior Directors & Vice Presidents) to partner on initiatives that drive the strategy impacting over 35,000 veterinarian customers and the Field and Corporate Account Teams made up of over 500 sales professionals at IDEXX. Partnership and collaboration are keys to success in this role, as you will be responsible for engaging the Commercial Leaders in driving the Sales Incentive strategic direction. Your Key Responsibilities Will Include Leadership: You’ll lead 6 people leaders who oversee Sales Compensation Analysts and Sales Support Analysts in North America and Brazil. The Americas Sales Operations organization consists of 40+ individuals and growing! Strategic Partnership: You’ll be responsible for partnering with the Senior Commercial Leaders to evaluate and implement new strategies, and will be a strong thought partner who considers issues across the entirety of our ecosystem. This includes both Field Sales and Corporate Accounts. Territory Management and Design: You’ll enhance coverage and capacity models: creating balanced territories with a focus on maximizing the face-to-face coverage for optimal relationship development. Goal Methodology and Planning: You’ll partner with key stakeholders to develop a goal methodology that ensures goal setting is appropriate for individual sales territory opportunity and is aligned to achieve the Company’s business objectives. Sales Incentive Compensation & Systems: You’ll ensure incentive compensation modeling for sales leaders and sales professionals are aligned with total compensation expectations and IDEXX business objectives. You’ll be responsible for the accurate and timely payment of quarterly sales compensation, and the usability of the Incentive Compensation system (Anaplan). Sales Support: You’ll be responsible for managing a team who partner with field sales professionals and leaders to design customer specific solutions. Legal and Finance Partnership: You’ll be responsible for all non-standard contracts and play an active role in managing customer defaults. Regional accountability: All of the above responsibilities across US, Canada and Brazil, with visibility to global implications. What You Will Need To Succeed To be successful, we are looking for an individual who has led leaders. Your key strengths will include resilience, a strong ability to influence a range of stakeholders, as well as the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts. You will have experience working within a matrixed organization where open lines of communication are critical. Collaborating and sharing information so that outcomes are well thought out is imperative. This leader is at the cross-road of multiple teams and objectives. You must be able to manage conflicts as they arise by communicating effectively and sharing “the why,” and you must be comfortable soliciting input from multiple stakeholders, making decisions, and handling challenging conversations. You’ll have 8-10 years of relatable experience, with at least five years in a similar role. Experience leading leaders and building effective teams. Strong business acumen. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration is a plus. Having an MBA would be advantageous. Fluent in English, both verbal & written. Location: This position will be hybrid. Our headquarters is based right outside Portland, ME. Time onsite would include training, leadership meetings, strategy and budget planning.

Additional Job Description As an Associate Scientist II in Technical Manufacturing, you will be involved in the production of antibodies, antigens, peptides, conjugates, small molecules, and microparticles for high quality veterinary diagnostic product reagents. Your focus of responsibility will be on the preparation of solutions and reagents by following standard protocols at the laboratory bench. You will participate on a technically focused team to support lab work, solve problems, as well as communicate and present to colleagues. You will have the opportunity to cross train across multiple processes and participate on a technically focused team as an approach to support lab work and solve problems. You will communicate and present to colleagues. You will operate under 5S and Lean Manufacturing principles and ISO standards. You can make a difference by producing innovative products that keep people and animals healthy. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. You can learn more about working with this team here . What will you do in this role? Produce antibodies, antigens, conjugates, coated microparticles, and other rare reagents. Order and maintain equipment and work area. Use strong documentation skills to ensure records are filled out according to standard operating procedures. Accurately report data and labor to the inventory control system. Adhere to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. Operate within an ISO 9001:2008 / 14001:2004 Quality Management System. Partner with manufacturing staff and production or product support groups to recommend, investigate, and/or implement modification of existing reagents and processes to improve quality and production efficiency. Have opportunities to validate new reagents, production processes, and/or equipment. Have opportunities to participate in continuous improvement initiatives. May provide production and process training to other employees.  What do you need to succeed? Two or more years’ experience with a bachelor’s degree in Biology, Chemistry, or Biotechnology or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Prior experience with protein purification, microparticle coating, and/or bioconjugation chemistry is a plus. Laboratory bench and instrumentation skills. Analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently and cooperatively as part of a team. Organizational skills and ability to plan work as well as to prioritize and multi-task. Takes initiative and is accountable; focuses on task at hand; detail oriented. Adaptable with ability to work well under pressure and handle the stress of deadlines. Ability to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a production environment – standing for 2hr+, sitting, phone and computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, occasionally climb, kneel, or bend, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. You can read and interpret documents such as safety rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), material safety data sheets (MSDS), operating and maintenance instructions, government rules, and technical procedures. We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.  Let’s pursue what matters together. IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

As an Associate Scientist I in Technical Manufacturing, you will be involved in the production of antibodies, antigens, peptides, conjugates, small molecules, and microparticles for high quality veterinary diagnostic product reagents. Your primary responsibility will be the preparation of solutions and reagents following standard protocols. You will operate under 5S, Lean Manufacturing principles and ISO standards when working at the laboratory bench. You will have the opportunity to cross train across multiple processes and participate on a technically focused team as an approach to support lab work and solve problems. You will communicate and present to colleagues. You can make a difference by producing innovative products that keep people and animals healthy. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. What will you do in this role? Produce antibodies, antigens, conjugates, coated microparticles, and other rare reagents. Perform other production-related activities. Use strong documentation skills to ensure records are filled out according to standard operating procedures. Accurately report data and labor to the inventory control system. Order and maintain equipment and work area. Adhere to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. Operate within an ISO 9001:2008 / 14001:2004 Quality Management System. Collaborate and communicate with colleagues and others in related areas to provide work support, exchange information, and ensure efficient processes. Have opportunities to participate in continuous improvement initiatives. What do you need to succeed? Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Chemistry, or Biotechnology or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Specific technical skills related to the applicable scientific specialty. Prior experience with protein purification, microparticle coating, and/or bioconjugation chemistry is a plus. Laboratory bench and instrumentation skills. Analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently and cooperatively as part of a team. Organizational skills and ability to plan work as well as to prioritize and multi-task. Takes initiative and is accountable (shows ownership); focuses on task at hand; detail oriented. Adaptable with ability to work well under pressure and handle the stress of deadlines. Ability to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a production environment – standing for 2hr+, sitting, phone and computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, occasionally climb, kneel, or bend, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. You can read and interpret documents such as safety rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), material safety data sheets (MSDS), operating and maintenance instructions, government rules, and technical procedures. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 10,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. As an Associate Scientist joining the Water R&D team you will assist in the development of solutions that make a world of difference in drinking, recreational and waste water to ensure public safety. Do you have a technical curiosity with an aptitude and belief that problems can be resolved and obstacles removable? In this role, you will perform a variety of scientific activities to support the development, maintenance, improvement and understanding of our products and production processes. You will participate on a technically focused team to solve problems using discretion and judgment. You will use advanced knowledge to analyze, interpret, and make deductions from varying facts or circumstances. Degree of work complexity and autonomy is dependent on level of experience. What You Can Expect In This Role You will be working in a laboratory environment in New Product Development . You will prepare materials, performs experiments, gathers data, carry out analyses and reaches conclusions. May also design experiments. You will document experiments and other lab or production activities. Prepares reports and summaries. Presents results and conclusions. Maintain appropriate records. You will collaborate and communicate with colleagues and others in related areas to provide work support, exchange information, ensure efficient processes, and plan team activities. May produce and/or test reagents and final products and perform other production-related activities. Maintains knowledge of products and procedures, developments in the field and industry and regulatory environment. Adheres to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. What You Will Need To Succeed You will have a Bachelor’s degree in Microbiology, Molecular Biology, Biology, Biochemistry, or a related field You will have laboratory bench and instrumentation skills as well as experience planning experiments and performing data analysis. You will be effective working both independently and as part of a team. You are highly analytical with problem solving skills with the ability to organize and plan work. You possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Preferably you have experience in microbiology, with specific focus on bacterial culture. identification, agar plating, aseptic and sterile technique. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork and quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive benefits. IDEXX BioAnalytics, Inc., a division of IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. is a leader in diagnostic testing for both the biomedical and life science market. Location: This position can be remote, with the ability to commute to our West Sacramento, CA laboratory as-needed. What can you expect? In Addition, The Successful Candidate Will In this role, you will play a key customer service and administrative role for our BioAnalytics business. The successful candidate will work closely with IDEXX’s sales team to onboard new clients and new Study participants. Set up new Veterinarian Clinical Testing (VCT) studies within our Ocelot system; Be the front facing customer support for all VCT studies; Help with supply orders for VCT’s; Assist in the VCT close out process; Work with AP to set up billing and correct coding; Assist the lab with questions from the client regarding testing. Required Skills And Abilities Outstanding Customer Service skills, ethos, and work experience Excellent Administrative skills (multi-tasking, Microsoft Office Suite Proficiency, organizational skills) Ideally, experience working in a Clinical Testing/Research environment, with experience managing projects or studies. Data gathering and analytical ability. Process improvement skills Excellent interpersonal skills. Project management ability. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work both individually and as a team player. PC skills, including Microsoft Office. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Extended hours may be required. Some travel required. As an IDEXX cardiologist you will use your expertise to provide critical diagnostic and treatment information to our customers, enabling veterinarians and pet owners to make the most informed decisions for the care of their animals. IDEXX cardiologists can work from anywhere, leveraging our technology platform to read cases and submit reports from any location. Across IDEXX, there is a vibrant energy that inspires caring and committed people to come together to advance the standard of care for the animals we love around the globe. IDEXX Telemedicine can work for you. Whether you are looking for peer collaboration, contributions to the profession, educational outreach, additional income, flexibility, better work/life balance, or career development, we can provide the avenue to make it happen. Visit our talent page to learn more about our team. We are always looking to gain a deep understanding of what matters to cardiologists. As such, we would love your feedback. Please complete the survey to share what matters to you. As an IDEXX Cardiologist you will… …have Global Collaboration We are a large, collaborative team of cardiologists spanning three continents. We encourage discussion and connection with members of the team. …use Innovative Technology We use an innovative platform that allows users the flexibility and technology to read cases and dictate reports in a format that works best for them. We have an entire R&D team dedicated to continuous improvement. Our platform allows collaboration, personal preferences, and ease of use all geared toward enhancing the customer and cardiologist experience. …participate in Continuing Education Our team regularly holds rounds and journal club. We also encourage participation in conferences, and, as an employee, IDEXX will reimburse your eligible expenses. …Advance Your Learning We are dedicated to supporting the veterinary specialty community and you. You will be supported in any desire you have, to participate in research, give lectures, and pursue your specialty. You are also invited to participate in our journal club and learning platform. …have Readily Available Support Our 24-hour specialist and IT support teams are available should you need them. Specialist Support and our Telemedicine Support Veterinarians communicate with referring clinics on technical problems or case inconsistencies, allowing you to focus on what you do best! …receive Mentorship From day one, you will be assigned an experienced and knowledgeable mentor who will help guide and support you throughout your introduction to our team. You will also have a manager and team surrounding you to support your experience. …create an Optimized Schedule We work with you to determine your schedule. Whether you’d like to be a consultant, full-time, or part-time employee, you will collaborate with our dedicated workforce manager to design an optimized schedule, which could even include split shifts to accommodate your lifestyle. What You Need To Succeed Board-certified cardiologist ( DipDACVIM or DipDECVIM-CA (Cardiology )) with a passion for helping people and pets. Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Analytical, can prioritize, and excel at problem-solving. Talk with your friends who work with IDEXX Telemedicine Consultants worldwide and contact: laura-petersongervais@idexx.com . Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. As a Veterinary Clinical Pathologist with IDEXX at our laboratory in Memphis, TN, you will have the opportunity to provide top quality diagnostic services for our veterinary clients in North America, reading a mix of both glass and digital slides. You’ll join a team of pathologists who are not only skilled and passionate about what they do, but who also value collaboration and sharing of ideas. In this role, you will be responsible for examination of clinical pathology specimens in order to provide clients with diagnostic evaluations, as well as any necessary follow-up consultation. A high-level of importance is placed on quality, timeliness, and customer service. This position qualifies for a $20K sign-on bonus and relocation assistance.* What You Can Expect You will be responsible for providing interpretations for clinical pathology to veterinary practices and veterinarians, including the processing of cytological specimens. You will participate in consultations with veterinary clients regarding the interpretation of pathology reports and other laboratory data and responding to client inquiries. You will also be able to consult with and assisting other pathologists on cases for relevant expertise You will interact with and advise lab personnel in proper specimen handling/ and processing techniques You will work with department supervisors for lab oversight to evaluate procedures and set standards of quality to ensure the quality of laboratory results You will promote the growth of IDEXX Veterinary Services by actively participating in quality control programs and the development of new tests You will provide continuing education courses/seminars for employees, clients and employees for all subsidiary companies of IDEXX Veterinary Services You will maintain proficiency and development of clinical diagnostic skills, routing diagnostic responsibilities and professional activities. What do you need to succeed in this role? Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) or equivalent required. Pathology Board Certified - American College of Veterinary Pathology (ACVP) or ECVP preferred. Familiarity with current topics and issues in clinical veterinary medicine. Ability to type and use dictation equipment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. A service-oriented attitude. Ability to organize and prioritize work. Computer skills are required. Physical Demands Extensive sitting and computer use Why IDEXX? As a Data Engineer, you will create data pipelines on our next-generation database build. You will assist with building robust, fault-tolerant data pipelines that collect, assemble, transform and aggregate distributed data into databases, operational data stores, data integration hubs, and data lakes. You will compile and install scalable cloud-based database systems and prepare data for analytical and operational uses. You will work to lay the groundwork for data consumers to easily retrieve and examine data sets to glean knowledge and insights. IT Data Engineering is responsible for designing and developing enterprise data collection, aggregation, and access systems for IDEXX's global business environment. We work with traditional data architectures such as enterprise data warehousing and larger cloud-based data centralization systems like data integration hubs. Our products are used to synchronize billions of data points between enterprise applications such as global ERP and CRM applications, collect and normalize reference lab results and clinical utilization, and create easy-to-access data sources for enterprise analytics, sales enablement tools, and data science initiatives. Our team includes a range of data engineers, data architects, and data-centric business system analysts, with a heavy focus on cloud-based "big data" projects. Some team members provide knowledge and support over our traditional data warehouse applications, building upon these environments with SQL and traditional ETL methods. At the same time, our newest technology addition expands our data models via Snowflake, bringing the best of cloud scale and compute capabilities, along with long-lived data engineering practices. Our stack: AWS, Snowflake, Oracle, MySQL, Python, Informatica In This Role Using multiple technologies, you will design and implement scalable, reliable distributed data processing frameworks and analytical infrastructure. You will define, design, and implement data integration, management, storage, consumption, backup, and recovery solutions that ensure the high performance of the organization's enterprise data. You will develop Structured Query Language (SQL), Data Definition Language (DDL), and Python or equivalent programming scripts to support data pipeline development, problem-solving, data validation, and performance tuning. You will adhere to and contribute to naming conventions, data governance practices, and thourough testing standards. You will document data design tasks or project requirements. You will implement measures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility. You will identify and resolve data-oriented problems, such as missing, duplicate or incorrect data. You will monitor performance and utilization. You will guide data design and requirements to other development and business teams. You will propose or develop semantic layer features for the enterprise model. You will provide ongoing maintenance and process improvements for data initiatives. What You Will Need To Succeed You have a bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. You have experience with relational databases such as Oracle, MySQL, and Snowflake. You are proficient in coding and programming languages such as Structured Query Language (SQL) and Python. You have experience with data integration/ETL tools such as Informatica PowerCenter or Sesame Relational Junction. You are familiar with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS). You understand data warehousing solutions and relational database theory. You have good verbal and written communication skills and can translate technical subject matter to non-technical audiences (both as a speaker and listener). You take the initiative in resolving problems and can balance conflicting requirements in partnership with others. You excel at customer service and building relationships with businesses. You excel at planning and organizing your work and can prioritize and be flexible with changing business needs. You are a self-starter and can work on your own and in teams. You can solve problems and draw conclusions, in some cases, with limited information. You worked with Agile software development methodology. What You Can Expect From Us Base annual salary target: $95000 -$105000 (yes, we do have flexibility if needed) Opportunity for annual cash bonus Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One 5% matching 401k Additional benefits include but are not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more! Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. IDEXX Laboratories, Inc, is currently seeking applications for a R&D Electrical Engineering Co-op for the Instrument Development Organization in Westbrook, ME (just outside of Portland, ME). This is an excellent opportunity for a creative engineer to join an innovative product development team bringing technological advanced diagnostic testing to the veterinarian’s office. At IDEXX, Co-ops are an integral part of a product development team and have a chance to make a real impact on engineering problems and solutions for our line of products that helps animals and water quality around the world. The primary market for IDEXX developed instruments is the assessment of pet health and well-being, within the veterinary clinic environment. Co-ops will contribute to the design, development, and prototyping of electronic hardware, and the associated embedded firmware, for diagnostic instruments. The Co-op may also be asked to work on the advanced development of proof of concept products, not yet in the development cycle. IDEXX utilizes Cadence PCB design tools (OrCAD / Allegro) for circuit design, supplemented by a variety of FPGA development tools for simulation and synthesis of on-board microprocessors, and has a fully equipped engineering laboratory. Co-ops will be immersed in this environment with the aim of contributing significantly to the development effort while gaining valuable real-world design experience. Duties And Responsibilities Perform the full variety of electrical & system engineering activities related to development of new products. Assist in design, development and test of diagnostic instruments from inception through transition to production in a team environment. Evaluate physical designs and verification protocols to identify potential risk areas. Assist engineers with component selection, design tradeoffs, circuit design and bring up/verification. Participate in brainstorming sessions to create new products, technologies and processes. Desired Skills Creative and innovative individual Ability to take initiative and provide leadership, when necessary Printed Circuit Board design experience preferred Familiarity with basic electronic measurement techniques (Voltage, current, and frequency measurements etc.) Familiarity with basic electro-mechanical devices (motors, valves, switches, sensors etc.) Hands-on aptitude The Co-op Experience In addition to professional experiences, IDEXX CO-OPs can participate in a variety of additional activities, including: Weekly small-group meetings to discuss their co-ops with other students and mentors “Lunch and Learn” seminars on research topics with our leadership team Workshops on relevant issues such as career planning, professional topics, etc. Co-op final presentations Social mixers and event Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Want to play a leading role in developing embedded software for cutting edge diagnostics analyzers that contribute to the health of our beloved pets? Want to make a difference in the day-to-day life of veterinarians and pet owners as part of a highly innovative and well-respected company? Want to work with innovative embedded systems and IoT solutions? IDEXX is building industry leading diagnostics analyzers used in veterinary clinics across the globe, and this is your chance to become part of our growing development team. We are looking for a technical leader to help us build and support strong development teams that understand the needs of our customers and are able to deliver value by making analyzers that are easy to use, reliable and deliver clinically accurate results. At IDEXX we build teams that work together with the shared purpose of enhancing the health and well-being of pets, people and livestock. The work is challenging and rewarding. Software plays an important role in the development and delivery of products and services to our veterinary customers. IDEXX offers the software and services—and partnerships—that practices of all types and sizes need to succeed. Dedicated, proactive support and training, plus unmatched integration, have made us an AAHA Preferred Provider of veterinary software—and the choice of more than 125,000 veterinary professionals. In This Role You will be responsible for managing, supporting and building effective cross-functional teams capable of working closely with our business partners and Product Owners to understand, execute and deliver embedded software based on business priorities In managing a cross functional team of Software Developers and Test Engineers, you will spend a portion of your time mentoring and coaching individuals to help them achieve their career goals - we view this as a key part of building and retaining a high-quality team Our teams operate in a fast-moving agile manner using the Scrum framework, so an understanding of Agile development practices and experience with Agile teams is a must You will work with a closely-knit team of businesspeople and technologists, and Agile specialists relying on your excellent communication and interpersonal skills The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background in embedded development and be familiar with the full product development lifecycle process You must be willing to continuously learn new things and apply those learnings, as we are constantly exploring new tools and technologies, and looking for new and better ways of working What You Will Need To Succeed Experience leading a team of developers with a focus on cross functional collaboration Experience investing in the growth and development of your team members Experience collaborating with business and technical leaders Experience working on a cross functional Agile Scrum team Experience working with Linux based embedded systems An understanding of DevOps and cybersecurity as they apply to software development processes Why IDEXX? As a Staff Embedded Software Engineer, you will be part of a dynamic cross-functional team participating in all phases of software development. While contributing to a full stack software environment that includes a range of embedded technologies you will be able to prototype, develop new products and contribute to on-market instruments. Working closely with product owners and senior staff your team will bring business requirements to product development, explore problem space, and apply novel solutions. As an engineer with deep application development and embedded experience, you will provide leadership to deliver quality software that meets our customers needs. Essential to this role is a DevOps mindset and a strong desire to learn. Instrument Software directly contributes to the real time care of companion animals by bringing premium bench top clinical analyzers to life with full-stack embedded solutions. These analyzers ensure the health and well-being of animals, simplify the workflow of veterinary technicians and enable the success of veterinary businesses of all sizes. Our team operates in a fast paced, agile environment. We strive for fast feedback in our development cycles and seek to continuously learn and adapt. What You Will Need to Succeed: • You possess 7+ years of software development experience • C or C++, Linux embedded experience required, Python experience optional/nice to have • You possess deep knowledge of computer science principles and practices in both design and implementation • You have demonstrated the ability to work in a collaborative environment, working across engineering and the business to deliver working software that meets customer needs • You have demonstrated experience in providing effective technical leadership • You have extensive experience working with embedded Linux platforms • You possess excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills • You have a desire to work in a multi-disciplinary team environment, utilizing agile development methods, test driven development, automated testing, and continuous integration • You possess excellent analytic and communication skills • You have a great attitude and a desire to learn and have fun • You possess a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, a related area, or equivalent experience Why IDEXX? As an Engineering Automation Maintenance Manage r (Off Shift), you will be accountable for providing leadership and overseeing the day-to-day operation of the automation maintenance department, including functions associated with maintenance, repair, troubleshooting, operation, and repair of production equipment to ensure equipment OEE goals. Act as liaison with production and engineering departments in the prioritization of projects and repairs. Ensures documentation, procedures, and metrics are kept up to date and in compliance. This position will oversee both 2nd and 3rd shift. Shift hours listed below. Flexibility to cover both shifts when needed. 2nd shift - Monday - Friday - 2:30pm - 11:00pm 3rd shift - Sunday - Thursday - 10:30pm - 7:00am What You Can Expect In This Role Lead the 2nd and 3rd shift automation maintenance department. Establish work schedules, shift assignments and work prioritization. Ensure engineering maintenance department compliance with all company policies and procedures. Maintain collaborative and positive relationships with all other department. Proactively improve department processes and strive for enhanced levels of efficiency. Ensure service calls and machinery repairs are completed in a timely manner and maintenance support is available as needed. Provide mentoring and coaching on equipment troubleshooting and maintenance activities for all existing and new manufacturing equipment and systems. Establish procedures and best practices for the engineering team. Train team on these procedures and best practices, including follow-up verification. Oversee CMMS system to track equipment failures, problems, spare parts, maintenance logs to assist in increasing equipment uptime and reliability. Ensure documentation of maintenance work and activities performed, including work orders, engineering change requests, drawings, sketches, CAD files, procedures, project logs, etc. Develop and revise standard operating procedures (SOPs). Participate in value engineering projects to increase production efficiency and capacity, reduce cost, improve quality, and improve equipment reliability and uptime. Develop and execute plan for achieving and maintaining Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) of 85% or higher on all manufacturing and process equipment. Guide, consult and perform on-going problem solving, root cause analysis, and process refinements in collaboration with internal personnel and suppliers. Ensure that equipment is maintained in compliance with company, USDA, and ISO requirements. Lead department 5S program and promote a safe work environment. Spearhead and support value engineering projects to increase production efficiency and capacity, reduce cost, improve quality, and improve equipment reliability and uptime. Evaluate, recommend, and implement process, machine, and design improvements to production equipment and procedures. Carry out leadership responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing and training employees, planning, assigning, and directing work. Perform other duties as required by manager. Education And Experience 4-year Degree in engineering discipline (mechanical, electrical, industrial, manufacturing) from a college or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 5+ years’ experience in a maintenance supervisory role in a manufacturing/production environment . E xperience implementing and managing program level initiatives. Knowledgeable and experienced with manufacturing, automation, and process control equipment. Solid technical background with strong troubleshooting, diagnostics, and process improvement skills with automated manufacturing, automation controls, and process control equipment. USDA, and ISO experience preferred. What You Need To Succeed High level of knowledge and experience with maintenance management, preventive maintenance, and TPM. Knowledgeable in Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS), tracking problems, spare parts, work orders, etc. Strong interpersonal, leadership, management, and supervision skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Superior technical writing skills for developing SOPs, engineering change orders. Strong project management and planning. Proficient in MS Windows and MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio) Effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Quick learner with the desire and ability to learn and grasp new technology, equipment, and skills. Collect, analyze, and organize data to present in a form that aids root cause analysis. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to perform well both independently and in teams. Ability to read mechanical blueprints, electrical and fluidic schematics, and process control flow charts. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to generate, interpret, and explain with clarity, complex mechanical design drawings and documentation. Other Preferred Skills And Abilities USDA, FDA, GMP, Military, ISO knowledge and background Equipment & Process Validation Knowledge/Experience (IQ/OQ/PQ) Lean Six Sigma Why IDEXX? jobTitle: Engineering Manager - Reagent New Product Transition
jobDescription: As the New Product Transfer Manager, you will lead a dedicated team of approximately 6 process transfer engineers focused on effective and efficient transfer and set up of manufacturing processes from our R&D development teams into the Operations infrastructure. Your team is responsible for on-time transfers and interfaces with all areas of operations to ensure a smooth transition of all aspects of product launch and manufacture. You will drive efficiency through improvements and standardization efforts, and active coaching and development of team members. The ideal candidate operates with a strategic, integrated and analytical mindset. What You Can Expect In This Role You will review and prioritize Product development and launch schedules, build plans, and resource commitments, and planning capacity and department operations and establishing priorities and sequences for manufacturing products. It will be your role to ensure the best use of your organizational resources in defining and planning goals, objectives, and programs to achieve the strategic plan and to achieve growth and profitability. You will develop and implement strategies to increase efficiency, maintain quality and ensure continuous improvement of policies, systems, and procedures. Lead and identify aspects of all new product introductions that impact current manufacturing or new product development timelines. You will balance competing objectives to meet aggressive launch timelines from R&D with complex implementation timelines in Operations You will serve as a liaison between operations, marketing, commercial, and finance organizations, fostering a highly-collaborative, cross-functional environment where your colleagues seek out your advice and guidance to resolve obstacles as they arise You will develop, grow and strengthen individuals’ capabilities and stay current with industry best practices. What You Need To Succeed In This Role You have a BS in a science or engineering field of study 5+ years of managing a team of scientists and/or engineers You have basic business finance literacy, including cost center management experience Project management experience is essential, formal credential or coursework is highly desired Your strong knowledge of SAP/MRP systems, Microsoft Excel, and other technology platforms is essential You have experience synthesizing diverse product, scientific, engineering and business requirements into straightforward architectures. You have a successful track record working with cross-functional development teams. You are a continuous learner who embraces a growth mindset. You possess strong communication skills and ability to influence across groups. You have excellent analysis and data-driven decision-making skills. You will be adept in identifying and implementing process improvements and integrating Lean methodologies. The ability to communicate risk to a variety of stakeholders, recommend solutions and create alignment is imperative. You will have the skills to lead and make decisions during times of ambiguity. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 9,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. As an Engineering Specialist within the New Product Transition group, you will support the development, transfer, and ongoing operations of key products across multiple functions and lines of business. In this role you will act as a liaison between cross-functional groups and ensure the smooth transition of new products into steady-state operations encompassing multiple manufacturing and support modalities. You will work with established highly functioning teams as they seek to further optimize transfer processes, accelerate time-to-market and continue to deliver high-value and high-quality products to our customers. This is a dynamic role that will span many facets New Product Development! Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will provide Operations input to new product development teams within the IDEXX New Product Development (NPD) process. You will work with new product development teams and your responsibilities will include supporting the successful transfer of new products from R&D to Operations. You will assist in developing products and processes within overall integrated manufacturing/product support system encompassing complete range of sciences, engineering, manufacturing, marketing, customer and other essential inputs to ensure end products meet requirements and can be manufactured to meet cost, quality and availability requirements. You will assist in developing and implementing new processes to assemble and test products, including working with tooling, test fixtures and software tools. You will create manufacturing and service standard operating procedures (SOPs) and conduct training for International Organization for Standardization (ISO) compliance. You will develop and support tooling, jigs and software, including coordination of calibrated tools. You will coordinate with testing, software and other engineering areas as needed to evaluate and solve manufacturing/service issues. You may lead work activities of others, coordinating daily activities and providing training, coaching and guidance. You will perform engineering work related to the research, design, manufacture, troubleshooting and service of company products. You will gather, analyze and report on data. You will make recommendations on engineering solutions. You will characterize systems (equipment and processes) by breaking them down into their component parts, mapping out how each function will work within the overall system to make sure the system will operate as intended. You will ensure systems provide for margin for failure in operation to achieve acceptable results even in off-nominal conditions. You will qualify equipment and processes by determining measurable product requirement standards. You will coordinate with a wide range of life sciences, chemistry, biology, engineering and other disciplines to capture design history and transfer design knowledge to downstream support organizations. You will be responsible for moderate size projects/programs with high complexity and multiple variables. You will contribute to business process improvements. You will work independently when needed, receiving minimal guidance. What You Will Need To Succeed Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Ability to manage tasks and projects through to successful completion and attainment of goals. Data gathering and analytical ability. Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical personnel verbally and in writing. Will have built or able to build a small established network of internal and external resources. Ability to work collaboratively as member of cross-functional teams. Adept in identifying and implementing process improvements and integrating Lean methodologies. Ability to communicate risk, recommend solutions and create alignment. Computer skills in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) and other advanced software (Solid Works, JMP) as required. Some working knowledge of SAP preferred. Why IDEXX? As an Engineering Technician you will troubleshoot and repair custom automation and OEM manufacturing equipment. Perform maintenance on mechanical systems including robotics, pick and place, and cam driven equipment. Candidate must possess the ability to disassemble, repair and reassemble complex mechanical assemblies. Perform technical evaluation of events to determine root cause and recommend corrective action. Compile and analyze engineering data, patterns and other information and draw conclusions. Work closely with engineering and production management to prioritize daily work activities. Required Hours 1st Shift – 6:30am – 3:00pm Monday – Friday What You Need To Succeed High school diploma or equivalent required. Associates Degree in a technical (mechanical/electrical) or relevant discipline preferred. Equivalent military background including technical experience and training desirable. Solid technical background and experience with troubleshooting, diagnostics, maintenance, and process improvement skills on automated manufacturing and process control equipment including but not limited to: electrical, mechanical, electro-mechanical, control systems, robotics, Allen Bradley/GE PLC , human-machine interfaces (HMI), motion control, servo/stepper motors, pneumatics, sensors, actuators, and fluid pumping systems. Strong preventive maintenance knowledge and experience. Requirements 5+ years of experience working in a technical capacity preferred Technical aptitude. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. The ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong customer service and communications skills, both verbal and written. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Good computer skills; Experience with a Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS), Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Power Point experience preferred. Critical thinking, evaluation and judgement skills. Experience working in a regulated work environment is a plus. (ISO, USDA, FDA) Ability to use schematic drawings for fabrication, analysis and problem solving, if applicable. Physical Demands And Work Environment Extensive sitting, standing and computer use. Extend and reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Some travel required. Work with exposed moving electro-mechanical parts. Work with exposed electrical power requiring proper protective equipment. Office, engineering lab and industrial environments requiring safety, electrostatic discharge (ESD), clean room and other equipment. Additional work with electrical solder and fluxes, exposure to supplier assembly processes using chemicals, with machinery noise. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 10,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. As an Engineering Technician II within the Hematology Product Support team, you will work on engineering efforts to aid in the support of IDEXX’s hematology analyzers in manufacturing and the field. In this role you will work side by side with engineers to perform problem solving investigations, system characterization, verification and validation testing, data analysis, protocol & report generation, and various other engineering activities. You will work with established highly functioning teams as they seek to further optimize the performance of IDEXX’s hematology products, and the customer experience associated with them. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory, compliance and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will coordinate and collaborate with customer support, manufacturing, process engineering, testing, software, and other engineering areas as needed to evaluate and solve product performance issues in manufacturing and the field. You will perform engineering work related to the manufacture, operation, troubleshooting and service of company products. You will assist in test protocol development and execution. You will gather, analyze, and report on data. You will make recommendations on engineering solutions. You will characterize systems (products and processes) by breaking them down into their component parts and mapping out how each function will work within the overall system. You will contribute to business process improvements. You will work independently when needed, receiving minimal guidance. In addition to your current areas of expertise, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skills within a wide variety of disciplines. What You Will Need To Succeed High school diploma or equivalent required. Associates Degree in a technical (mechanical/electrical) or relevant discipline preferred. Strong technical problem-solving and critical thinking abilities. You are a continuous learner who embraces a growth mindset. Ability to manage tasks and projects through to successful completion and attainment of goals. Data gathering and analytical ability. (Familiarity with JMP preferred) Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical personnel verbally and in writing. Ability to work collaboratively as a member of cross-functional teams. Computer skills in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) and other advanced software (Solid Works, JMP) as required. Some working knowledge of SAP preferred. Why IDEXX? As the Executive Chef, you are responsible for the overall vision and performance of the IDEXX Hospitality Dining and Catering Culinary teams – a global facilities function. You will supply day-to-day direction, supervision and inspiration to the culinary staff and culinary operations and will collaborate across the organization to successfully deliver services to a diverse population. It is our expectation that you are an experienced leader who is up to date on culinary skills and trends and that you use this knowledge to create culinary experiences that will exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate is motivated, passionate about food and has a strong desire to be part of an extraordinary team. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and without disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will collaborate with stakeholders to create, implement, and uphold the culinary vision of IDEXX Hospitality. You will assist stakeholders in developing projects and strategies to enhance dining experiences. You will be responsible for the oversight of multiple on- and off-site revenue centers and a full-service in-house catering team. You will oversee menu planning, pricing, inventory, ordering, food preparation, presentation, portioning and plate design. You will implement changes to menus, pricing, recipes, and cooking methods to improve upon consistency, food quality, attractiveness, and efficiency. You will train the culinary staff in cooking and serving methods, presentation and portion control; you will exhibit a hands-on approach to training and development, working alongside employees while demonstrating a commitment to their individual growth. You will establish an environment of team and individual accountability. You will lead by example and assist in cooking and preparing food when necessary and will maintain a clean, well-organized workspace. You will participate in professional organizations, conferences and training activities, representing the department as required or assigned. You will remain current with industry trends and participate in the development and training of staff of new concepts. You will hold culinary meetings to discuss feedback, menus/recipes, new trends, training opportunities, safety concerns and guidelines. You will foster teamwork, employee engagement, motivation, and open communication. You will coach and develop employees using a consistent approachable demeanor and clearly articulate expectations. You will remain flexible, and will problem solve with customer or employees as needed. You will use excellent customer service skills and professional etiquette to gain insight into customer feedback and respond to customers. You will make recommendations regarding employee matters including hiring, training, performance reviews, promotions, and disciplinary action up to and including termination. You will contribute directly to the departmental financial goals by effectively monitoring and establishing labor, inventory, food costing and pricing models, and respond to volume and market price fluctuations as needed. You will manage food, supplies, and equipment purchases and recommend appropriate inventory management practices. You will value safety and ensure your team always has safety top of mind. You will ensure compliance with all state and county health department and safety regulations and maintain high standards of sanitation as a unit priority. You will conduct routine inspection of preparation, storage, and service areas ensuring proper sanitation is maintained as well as the health and safety of dining guests and employees. You will ensure that all service equipment is operational and handled safely, reporting mechanical issues through ServiceNow. You will evaluate and refine traditional purchasing protocols to increase the sustainability of purchasing decisions and protect the environment by purchasing from local suppliers and others who support and practice sustainability. What You Will Need To Succeed You have a minimum of seven years of progressively responsible experience as a chef in a high volume, high quality operation with a variety of concepts and/or catering and banquet experience. Executive level experience is preferred. You have a degree in Culinary Arts from an accredited culinary school or apprenticeship program and/or equivalent experience. You are ServSafe certified. You are professional, confident, mature, creative, flexible and a highly organized team player with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects simultaneously. You are passionate about local, regional, international, and ethnic cuisines and love to inspire others. You have comprehensive knowledge of culinary techniques, menu planning, recipe and menu development, dining trends, food ordering, budget and pricing. You have strong organizational and logistical skills coupled with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a diverse team. You have exceptional verbal and written communication and customer service skills. You are proficient in MS applications- Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook; and ability to use menu management and productions system. You can meet the physical demands of the job – prolonged standing and walking, the ability to safely lift or move 50 pounds. You are comfortable interacting with multiple levels of management and understand the importance of honoring commitments and keeping confidence. You can work in a dynamic environment and can shift priorities and modify focus while multi-tasking.  You understand the impact the food service industry has on the environment and can inspire others to make choices towards a more sustainable future. Competencies include: Customer Focus, Drives Results, Collaborates, Values Differences, Situational Adaptability. Specific vision requirements include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to focus. Ability to work overtime hours as required. As a Facilities Associate, you will perform general cleaning and upkeep for our World Campus office, laboratories, and industrial spaces. IDEXXis hiring immediately for motivatedindividuals that love to clean and have a high attention to detail. The Janitorial Specialist Individuals in these janitorial positions will ensure the buildings, grounds, and equipment are in a clean, orderly, and safe condition. Schedule: This is a 1st shift position. Multiple positions open, apply today! What You Can Expect In This Role You may be responsible for any or all of the following: You will be asked to complete cleaning tasks including, but not limited to, cleaning and sanitation of restrooms, waste removal, wet and dry cleaning of walls, floors, ceilings, windows, furniture, elevators, water fountains, waste receptacles, corridors, halls, stairwells, lounges, lobbies, locker rooms, offices, cubicles, doors, woodwork, metal, café tables and other tasks as assigned. Understand and follow cleaning procedures for all area types and tasks as assigned. You may collect, separate, and remove solid and recycled waste to the appropriate disposal locations. You will read and follow standard operating procedures, work instructions and guidance documents as required by regulatory standards. You will perform tasks in a safe and responsible manner observing safety and security protocols. You will report and communicate maintenance deficiencies, carpet stains, cleaning projects and safety concerns. You will participate in office moves including breaking down and rebuilding offices, moving totes, computer and phone moves, etc. You will install, maintain and repair facility structures including painting, Sheetrock repair, ceiling repair, door maintenance and repair, etc. You will respond to emergency maintenance requests as needed. You may perform offsite warehouse inventory tracking and storing. You will perform building audits to identify the need and/or opportunity for maintenance and repair. What You Need To Succeed High School degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Associates degree or equivalent preferred. You will have knowledge of building services or trade-specific skills/knowledge. You will have strong communication/customer service skills both verbal and written. You will have strong contract and vendor management skills. You will have the ability to manage and delegate without direct reporting relationships. You will have the ability to prioritize, organize and multi-task. You will have effective team building and commitment skills. You will have the ability to assess and define problems with a variety of variables, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. You will have the ability to read and interpret documents and instructions in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. You will have demonstrated proficiency with mathematical concepts. You will have the ability to write reports and correspondence. Physical Demands Full use of hands including fingers to handle, feel, and use objects, tools and/or controls. Required to stand and walk an average of 5-10 miles per day. Moderate to heavy lifting in excess of 50 pounds as well as the ability to frequently move over 100 pounds on a cart, barrel, bin, or dolly. Specific vision requirements include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to focus. Ability to work overtime hours as required. Weekend hours may be required Work Environment Office, Production, Laboratory and Warehouse environment Occasionally works near moving mechanical parts, works in outside weather conditions, and also occasionally uses a ladder. As a Facilities Mechanic for IDEXX’s headquarters in Westbrook, Maine, you will be responsible for providing support in HVAC maintenance and operations, refrigeration maintenance and troubleshooting, and building automation systems troubleshooting and repairs. Schedule: This is a full-time, 1st shift position with a weekly schedule of Monday-Friday 7am-3:30pm. What You Can Expect In This Role You may be responsible for any or all of the following: You will maintain the work order system and work with customers to ensure their needs are met. You will maintain HVAC, chilled water, air compressor, and steam and hot water distribution systems according to established maintenance schedules and appropriate maintenance functions as indicated by manufacturer’s specifications and work instructions. You will install, operate, service and repair refrigeration equipment including compressor repair and replacement, coil cleaning and maintenance, fan replacement, troubleshooting and repair of controls systems. You will install electrical/plumbing components to repair equipment or improve equipment performance. You will maintain and operate building automation systems including Siemens Apogee, Johnson Controls Metasys and Einstein operating systems. You will repair and maintain physical structure of the facility infrastructure. You will perform other facilities tasks as necessary. What You Need To Succeed 2 + years’ experience in HVAC, refrigeration systems, or another mechanical trade is a plus Experience with chilled water distribution systems and chiller operation and troubleshooting is preferred Low- and high-pressure boiler, plumbing, natural gas, electrical, or refrigeration license or equivalent combination of education and experience is a plus Experience with Einstein Controls, Siemens Apogee or Johnson Control Metatsys is highly desirable. 2 + years’ experience installing, adjusting, and repairing building automation system components, adjusting control systems to optimize system performance, including developing sequence of operations to increase the operating efficiency of facility equipment. Experience using CMMS Systems such as IBM Maximo would be a plus Universal EPA Certification for refrigerants is preferred You will have the ability to read and interpret documents. You will have the ability to write routine reports and correspondence. You will have the ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. You will have the ability to calculate figures and amounts including basic algebra and geometry. You will have the ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. You will have the ability to interpret a variety of instructions. You will have a valid driver's license. Physical Demands Frequently required to walk and use hands and fingers to handle objects, tools, or controls. Occasionally required to stand, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Occasionally lift and or move up to 75 pounds. May be required to perform “on-call” duties on 1st, 2nd, 3rd or weekend shifts as assigned. Work Environment Occasionally works near moving mechanical equipment, in high precarious places, and in outside weather conditions. Occasionally exposed to wet and humid conditions, fumes or airborne particulate, toxic and caustic chemicals, and risk of electrical shock. jobTitle: Field Sales, BioAnalytics Academic/Government Account Manager - Southeast Territory
jobDescription: IDEXX BioAnalytics’ scientific expertise takes a novel approach to the discovery of new diagnostic tests that supplement a robust portfolio of products and services. We partner with Pharma, BioTech, and Academia (the scientific community) to improve animal and human health. This BioAnalytics division is a subset of IDEXX which focuses on the research community. We are a dynamic and growing division of IDEXX, focused on animal health monitoring, preclinical laboratory diagnostic services (GCP), and biologic materials testing, including Cell Line Authentication. For more information about what we offer, visit www.idexxbioresearch.com In this role… As a BioAnalytics sales rep, your role would be to maintain and grow the animal health monitoring lab business, as well as expand the preclinical research and biologic material testing services segments of the business within the academic and government markets. Your customers would be found in academic, government and not-for-profit research institutions. You’d most frequently be talking to Principal Investigators, Lab Animal Resource Teams, and Clinical Veterinarians Your responsibilities include cultivating long term relationships with key opinion leaders in your territory to garner business in support of preclinical research projects and increasing the research animal health monitoring laboratory business -- both maintaining and growing. You will establish and maintain relationships of existing and potential customers, including preparing and following up on quotations and bids. Deliver seminar-type presentations to individuals or groups of potential and existing customers on our complete range of services, in both a virtual and in-person environment. Complete all sales administration, including completing all Salesforce.com requirements & territory management activities. Business review participation, including presentation of financial models, cost justification, comparison and market feedback. Communicate competitive issues to marketing organization and business unit manager. Responsible for translating customer needs into custom profiles Responsible for customer billing questions, assistance in resolution disputes, collections and customer satisfaction. Achieve and maintain technical knowledge and situational fluency of Bioresearch Market. What do you need to succeed? You have knowledge of life sciences in a research environment Your education would be a B.S. in Biology, Chemistry or other Life Science Related Field and Masters Degree or advanced degree is preferred 2+ years of successful Life Science, Research, or Preclinical sales experience in the life-science market required, animal model sales experience preferred Previous experience selling into top Life Science accounts (Academic, Government, and Not-for-Profit) preferred Minimum 2 years laboratory experience in life science research strongly preferred, including animal studies - "on the bench" experience Experience selling into life science research markets Strong experience and understanding of comparative research and animal studies Demonstrated ability to develop, grow and manage customer relationships Strong Territory Management and Organization - ability to successfully manage and grow a multi-state territory Demonstrated strong sales and closing skills as well as consultative sales Documented track record of success in achieving sales goals. Strong interpersonal skills – ability to build strong customer relationships, and build outstanding relationships with customers & colleagues Skilled in needs assessment and able to develop customer specific solutions. Professionally mature, with flexibility and the ability to adapt to an independent and team-oriented environment. Integrity, keeping commitments to colleagues, customers and the company Must possess a valid driver’s license Experience with Salesforce.com highly preferred Compensation Information Compensation averages between $155,000 - $165,000 / year base including at plan quarterly commission (salary is based on candidate’s background, experience, and geographic location) Robust quarterly commission plan Annual bonus eligible Additional perks and benefits included Territory Information Southeast territory includes: Maryland, Virginia, D.C., West Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Alabama, Tennessee, Kentucky, Arkansas, Mississippi, Louisiana, Texas and Oklahoma. The ideal home-base location is in Maryland, Virginia or the D.C. area. This would limit travel to 40% overnight travel. Physical Demands 40% Travel, some overnight travel. Some weekend work. jobTitle: Field Sales, North American Distribution Sales Manager-Livestock, Poultry & Dairy Division
jobDescription: The IDEXX Livestock, Poultry, and Dairy division offers diagnostic tests and services to monitor the health of herd and flock animals worldwide. We partner with state, government, and private laboratories to provide producers (farmers) with results that protect human health, improve animal productivity, and ensure food quality. Be responsible for the Initial training of clients and distributor sales on products, including troubleshooting and customer service in conjunction with technical service. Manage the Channel product launch of exciting new product(s) both internally and externally to ensure consistency with contracts and implementation. Integrity, keeping commitments to employees, customers and the company. Able to demonstrate modeling and authentic support for IDEXX mission, values and principles. Solid organization skills. Ability to demonstrate strong sales and communication skills including presenting in front of groups of veterinarians and producers. Must be professionally mature, and able to adapt to independent and team-oriented environment. General business knowledge. Multi-tasking, creativity, technical aptitude, proven track record, computer skills, and knowledge of veterinary diagnostics preferred.
