jobTitle: Field Sales, Veterinary Diagnostic Consultant-Champaign, IL Territory
jobDescription: Communicating the true value of our veterinary diagnostic and technology products and services is at the heart of our IDEXX’s commercial business. Our sales professionals develop deep and meaningful relationships offering solutions to meet our customers' unique needs. As a Veterinary Diagnostic Consultant, you will be on the front lines working to build strong relationships with our Veterinary customers to help sell IDEXX’s medical device diagnostics portfolio of products. In this field sales role, you will engage customers through knowledgeable interactions, business discussions and educational opportunities about what IDEXX has to offer. You will leverage your consultative selling techniques to translate customer needs into diagnostic solutions that leverage IDEXX's suite of products and services. In helping veterinary practices grow their diagnostic revenue, you will establish yourself as a valued partner. What You Can Expect In This Role You will leverage your ability to independently manage your territory and customer base in order to increase the recurring diagnostic revenue year over as well as attain quarterly medical device equipment sales. By increasing the utilization of in-house diagnostic tests and assays, instrument consumables and reference laboratory profiles and advanced tests among your customer base, you will in turn, increase the recurring revenue. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and “co-sell” with other IDEXX sales professionals in the region to close the capital equipment and technology. Being able to educate and train veterinary clinic staff about products, services and marketing initiatives, including how to engage customer service is an important part of your role. In order to do this, you will maintain comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of IDEXX's products and services. You’ll be responsible for communicating customer needs as well as competitive issues to both IDEXX's marketing organization and your business unit manager. This 2-way customer loop will also require you to partner with and assist laboratory operations to ensure that customer questions and service issues are satisfactorily addressed and resolved. You will present IDEXX's values to our customers in a professional manner, including an understanding of our industry, veterinary practice, customers, technology, operations and processes. You will have the opportunity to attend trade shows and other educational events in the region. You’ll be asked to manage IDEXX expenses and resources in line with company guidelines and directives What You Need To Succeed You possess bachelor's or equivalent combination of education and experience. You have 5 or more years of proven experience successfully managing your own sales territory Your territory management sales experience has been in the veterinary/animal health industry, Human Healthcare medical device sales, dental device sales, and/or prior capital equipment sales. You are able to work well with others in a highly team oriented, collaborative, sales environment You are able to meet the requirements of a field sales role that include but are not limited to extensive car travel (company car provided), occasional travel overnight if needed, as well as flexibility for potential weekend work (as needed) to attend tradeshows or other occasion meeting, and are able to lift up to 60 pounds. This is veterinary sales; you should be comfortable with going into veterinary clinic and hospital environments. Candidates must reside within, nearby or be willing to relocate into, our Champaign, IL territory (greater Urbana, Decatur, Taylorville, Charleston, Paris, Danville, Lafayette, Rensselaer, Watseka areas) This position is a field-based role by its nature requires travel and visits to veterinary clinics. Due to the current pandemic, as it relates to COVID-19, our employees' safety and well-being are top of mind for us. For those employees that continue to work with our customers in person, we have strengthened the preventative health measures already in place with new, more stringent actions. This includes limiting site visits, enabling virtual meetings, and providing customer advance expectations of how to protect themselves and our employees during the visit; recommending actions like making space for social distancing, use of mask/PPE, sanitize workstations, daily wellness checks, and keeping lines of communication open regarding risk levels. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. jobTitle: Field Support Regional Manager - Florida Regions
jobDescription: We build some of the most innovative products in the veterinary diagnostic and software industry, each of which helps keep our pets happy and healthy. jobTitle: Field Support Representative, Diagnostic Imaging - Minneapolis Territory
jobDescription: As a Field Support Representative (FSR) you will work closely with your Field Sales Representatives and Customer Support to develop strategies to maintain your Customer Accounts through education and other customer centric solutions. You would install and train the staff in the clinic on the best way to use IDEXX Diagnostic Imaging Systems. You would also assist with critical customer need visits, providing onsite technical support when things are not going according to plan. No two days will ever be the same. As an FSR you would be expected to visit customers in the field every day; occasionally adjusting your schedule as needed to attend customer events and to accommodate visits to emergency practices. 75% Travel (3-4 overnights a week away from home) We build some of the most innovative products in the veterinary diagnostic industry, each of which helps keep our pets happy and healthy. The veterinarians that use these tools rely on Field Support Representatives to teach them how to make the best use of these machines and to troubleshoot if there are technical issues. We are looking for people, like you, who are expert communicators, are highly organized, and who treat every customer interaction with empathy and teamwork. Ideal candidate location: Minneapolis, Minnesota. What can you expect? You can expect to have a dynamic and exciting career with IDEXX that utilizes your veterinary practice experience and technical skills, allows you to travel, meet new people, expand your knowledge and skill set, all while positively impacting the lives of pets and their owners. Our day to day consists of meeting new people and building relationships with our customers. Being able to build relationships and work as a positive team player is a must! You’ll be challenged every day as you work alongside the best team in the industry. The FSR role continues to evolve to best support our customers’ needs, so you can expect continued growth within your position through comprehensive training programs. The Field Support Representative positions are field based. You will work and travel from a home office. You would utilize a wide array of programs to plan and strategize your customer visits enabling you to serve as a true IDEXX Ambassador and to be viewed by your customers as a trusted advisor. You would be accountable for managing your schedule based on the unique attributes and needs of your customers, while also keeping a focus on your own professional development and growth. What do you need to succeed? Being able to build relationships with all personalities is a must! You also must enjoy life. This is a fun and fulfilling job. It may come across stressful at times, but it really is fun, and our team is amazing! You would get to visit some amazing towns and places as you work. To be successful in this role you will need to possess a minimum of three (3) years veterinary clinic experience with a training and/or leadership background strongly preferred. You can effectively communicate and collaborate with customers, management, and peers. You need to be able to build strong customer and peer partnerships that allow you to gain confidence and trust from others easily. Essential to success are the ability to plan and prioritize work in a dynamic environment and make quality, timely decisions. It is imperative that you have effective listening skills that are utilized to discover customer needs to adapt your approach and demeanor to different situations. You must be comfortable learning and using technology such as computers, tablets and Smartphones. Computer networking experience is a plus! Key Traits for Success as a Field Support Representative with IDEXX: Enthusiastic Attitude Persistence Ethical Self-Awareness Authenticity Emotional Intelligence Relationship Oriented Self-Motivated Shift info/travelling: Weekend hours and weekday overtime may be required. Overnight travel required. Requires up to 75% travel, both Air and Car travel (3-4 Overnights a week away from home) Valid Driver’s License required Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery.  At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement. Supervises day-to-day activities in a business unit/group/area/function/program. Supervises staff, assigns work and evaluates results. Contributes to development of unit/group/area/program operating policies and procedures. Collaborates closely with Foil and Slide manufacturing departments, as well as product support. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role Supervises day-to-day activities in a business unit/group/area/function/program. Supervises staff, assigns work, monitors activities and evaluates performance. Administers employment actions, provides coaching and guidance to staff and promotes staff training and development. Provides input to department policies and procedures. Balances workloads and overhauls department processes by creating updated SOP and Change Orders in QCBD to support area process improvements. Leads OLOL transfer of information and processes to team, while maintaining transitional inventory and WIP of current process. Identify all troubleshooting and improvement opportunities within new roll-out to gain maximum efficiency and yield. Leads work activities of the business unit/group/area/function/program; plans and organizes work, provides for adequate staffing and resources, and maintains work on schedule so that ongoing internal and/or external customer satisfaction is maintained. Builds customer relationships with Foil and Slide areas and manages escalated/critical issues. Communicates with other related departments to coordinate work and resolve issues as needed. Provides internal/external customer feedback and leads/participates in teams/projects related to business unit/group/area/function/program. Meets software release goals on time and efficiently. Leads/contributes to process/other improvements based on evaluation of existing procedures and business needs. Create KPIs for unit and utilizes data, metrics and system tools to ensure efficiency and to maximize customer experience. Inventory control and cycle counts, as well as SAP maintenance of Work Orders and on time closure. Identifies problems, obstacles and opportunities and proactively takes action to address issues. Strives for continuous improvement. Contributes to maintenance of department technology, software, instruments and systems resources. Coordinates with other departments and vendors as needed to resolve issues and maintain ongoing functionality. Prepares reports and other information summarizing work activities (KPI & shift reports). Identifies the need and prepares various analyses as needed to highlight issues and resolve questions. Maintains knowledge of Company products and services within business unit/group /area/function/program, as well as changes and developments in the industry affecting work activities. Responsible for implementing and growing cross training of techs in all areas of QC Catalyst testing. Provides back up ability to run test in their absence. What You Will Need To Succeed Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Supervisory skills and ability. Ability to organize, prioritize and direct work activities. Experience with the operations, products and services in the area supervised – testing of performance and precision of our products. Reasoning, problem solving, data gathering and analytical skills to resolve issues. Project management skills and abilities. Risk assessment experience preferred. Communication skills, both verbal and written. Personal computer skills, including Microsoft Office and .jmp experience preferred. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. As a Genetics Laboratory Technician at IDEXX BioAnalytics, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. In this role, you will perform molecular laboratory testing that helps serve professionals in the biomedical and life science fields across the globe. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork and quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive benefits. IDEXX BioAnalytics, Inc., a division of IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. is a leader in diagnostic testing for both the biomedical and life science market. The laboratory is based in Columbia, Missouri and employs approximately 60 people. Schedule This is a full time (40 hr/wk) day shift position with hours Monday-Friday 8:00-5:00pm (but could be flexible). Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Adherence to attendance-related policies and expectations is critical to this position. What can you expect? You Can Expect To Specialize In The Following Areas You will be using laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests aimed to help specialists to diagnose animal illnesses. You will be responsible for setting and running laboratory molecular tests and reading the results per laboratory’s SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). Nucleic acid extractions from a variety of sample types Molecular testing via PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) and Fragment analysis Use analyzer and other molecular diagnostic methods to generate STR (short tandem repeats) profiles of samples Reads and releases test results. May be cross trained and perform specimen processing responsibilities. Performs other duties as assigned. Pay: Hourly pay rate for this role typically starts at $19.35/hour. What do you need to succeed? Education 4-year degree in Science-related field preferred, or current coursework. Experience Typically, 1-2 years’ experience preferred. Required Skills And Abilities Nucleic acids extractions from several specimens’ types. Micro-pipetting skills. Ability to set up high-throughput molecular reactions, specifically PCR (Polymerase Chain reaction) reactions. General science background, including genetics is helpful. Attention to detail is a must. Organized with ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Organized with ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Ability to follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) as appropriate. Communication skills, both verbal and written. Positive, can-do attitude. Personal computer skills, including strong typing ability and proficient use of Microsoft Office Physical Demands Extensive sitting, phone and computer use. Capable of standing continuously for up to 2 hours. Extend and reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Hearing acuity sufficient to effectively communicate with customers and Employees via telephone and in person. Ability to communicate verbally on phone and in person. Fluency in the English language. Extended hours may be required. Work Environment Laboratory environment with potential biohazards present. Potential for exposure to agents known to cause disease in humans and use of potentially hazardous chemicals as defined by the National Hazard Communication Standards. A complete list of such chemicals is available from department supervision. We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. As a Product Owner for CAG’s Commercial Systems, you will manage a team of 6 Business Analysts which are accountable for the prioritization of the product backlog of the IDEXX Sales Customer Relationship Management System. As an IDEXX people manager, we look for the strong ability to motivate, inspire and to assemble innovative teams. jobTitle: Help Desk Support Specialist - 3rd Shift, Memphis Reference Lab
jobDescription: IT accelerates the success of IDEXX’s 9,000+ employees and customers by providing scalable and innovative solutions and leadership. We are a global organization that supports all technology needed to deliver products and solutions to customers enabling them to focus on delivering high quality patient care. We strive to provide exceptional customer service and experience in the most efficient means possible, requiring alignment and cross-functional communication. In this role... You will provide on-site Tier 1 and desk-side support for employees located in our IDEXX Memphis Reference Laboratory. You will answer incoming calls to Help Desk, providing telephone support to those that work at IDEXX, for computer systems or applications issues. You will troubleshoot problems and provides immediate resolution, or performs additional research as needed to resolve issues. Perform root cause analysis and develops checklists for typical problems. Recommend procedures and controls for problem prevention. Set clear and reasonable expectations as to resolution and time frame. Escalate problems to others as needed. Document issues and resolution on ServiceNow ticketing system. Perform receiving function for incoming IT related hardware and software. Images and sets up new and reconfigured IDEXX computers. Shares problem resolutions and unique cases with others on team to add to information knowledge base. Contributes to updated policies and procedures as needed. Discusses products, support and troubleshooting with hardware and software vendors as needed. What You Will Need To Succeed... 3 to 4+ years of experience providing IT Tier 1 and Tier 2 support of medium to high complexity. Strong ability to diagnose and troubleshoot software and hardware problems. Broad range of network and desktop knowledge including Windows 10, Microsoft Office 365, and popular browser configurations. Demonstrated experience with advanced hardware configurations. A+, Network+, and Security+ certifications are a plus High School degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Basic understanding of Active Directory. Experience working in a team setting, sharing information and assisting others with calls. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills; good telephone etiquette. Preferable experience working in a similar environment within a Reference Laboratory or large manufacturing environment. Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery.   At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement. We are passionate about what we do at IDEXX – and why wouldn’t we be? When you’re working to raise the standard of care for pets, make drinking water safe for billions and keep our livestock population around the globe healthy and free of disease, it’s no wonder that what we do each day is more than just a job. There’s an energy across IDEXX that is contagious – where caring and committed people come together to make things better. What’s in it for you? You can be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. The work of a Laboratory Assistant helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets across the United States. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork and quality and offers opportunities for personal growth. Check Out What Our Employees Have To Say Want to learn more about what it is like to work in Histology at IDEXX. https://vimeo.com/662998240 https://vimeo.com/663110312 https://vimeo.com/663393248 What Can You Expect? As a Laboratory Assistant, you will be assisting the lab with a variety of tasks. These could include: transporting samples to the correct department; opening sample bags as they come into the lab for clinical testing; stocking, various administrative tasks, and other duties as needed. Schedule: Tuesday-Saturday 2pm-10:30pm What do you need to succeed? A high school diploma and 1 year of relevant experience is required. Physical Demands Standing and sitting for long periods of time. Use hand, fingers and arms to handle objects, tools and controls. Occasionally required to climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Must occasionally lift and move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception, color vision and the ability to adjust and focus. Work Environment Laboratory environment with potential biohazards present. Potential for exposure to agents known to cause zoonotic disease in humans and use of potentially hazardous chemicals as defined by the National Hazard Communication Standards. A complete list of such chemicals is available from department supervision. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? As a clinically trained Histotechnologist or Histotechnician at IDEXX you’ll have the opportunity to use your HT and HLT skills in a whole new way. You will be a key contributor at IDEXX, the global leader in veterinary diagnostic. Yes, you read that right, Veterinary Diagnostics! What can you expect? Histologists at IDEXX perform dissection, grossing, embedding, microtomy, special staining, and complex tissue diagnostics on veterinary samples from dogs, cats, birds, reptiles, and all other pets big and small. Are you looking to make a difference in the lives of pets? The pet owner counts on it! Check Out What Our Employees Have To Say Want to learn more about what it is like to work in Histology at IDEXX. https://vimeo.com/662998240 https://vimeo.com/663110312 https://vimeo.com/663393248 Sign-on bonus considered for qualified candidate! Who should reach out? If you have at least 1+ years’ experience working in a diagnostic laboratory, in Histology, with knowledge of Good Clinical Practice (GCP). If you have specific experience in dissection, embedding, cutting, grossing or special stains. Complex Tissue a PLUS. If you desire a role as a coordinator, lab tech, leader or trainer - you will be a contributor to a team focused on operational excellence and the sharing of best practices, our team of laboratory professionals are dedicated, driven and results-oriented. Associates, Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. ASCP certification preferred. Ability to meet the physical requirements that go along with working in a lab – standing & sitting for 2+ hours, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Ability to support flexible schedules,. Pay shift differential as applicable. Work Environment This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule: We currently have three schedules available Sun-Thurs 2:30a-11a Tues-Sat 2:30a-11a Mon-Fri 6:30pm-3am Have we piqued your interest and are ready to learn more? Our Inside Sales Team is hiring for Inside Sales Support Representatives! Our representatives support our veterinary customer base by receiving inbound orders for diagnostic kits and instrument consumables and presenting additional IDEXX differentiated solutions and services. Come support our mission of delivering a world class experience by driving revenue growth and inspiring customer loyalty. Successful candidates will have a strong commitment to providing an excellent customer experience through relationship building and thrive in a fast-paced environment. These are non-commission based positions. You will earn bonuses based on performance. The start of training for these openings will be January 23, 2023. We'll be hosting a virtual event on November 8th at 4 PM EST where you can hear more about this and other Inside Sales and Leadership jobs directly from IDEXX employees. You'll learn about the day-to-day, possible career paths, and more. Want to join us? Sign up here. https://bit.ly/3DUf3pf In The Role Of Inside Sales Support Representative You will fulfill customer orders for diagnostic products and supplies through multiple channels including phone, fax, & email. You will establish credibility among our domestic veterinary customers to make recommendations for additional products and services. You will answer questions in regard to shipping inquiries and IDEXX online store to place orders. You will use Salesforce.com to maintain accurate customer profiles and interactions. You will provide an outstanding customer experience. You will be on the phone answering incoming calls from established veterinary customer’s and placing orders for an 8.5-hour shift. What you need to succeed? Sales, customer service and/or customer facing experience. Strong communication skills including written and verbal; strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish rapport quickly. Capability to absorb and articulate technical information. Highly motivated and goal-oriented, while working collaboratively for team success. Strong organizational skills, especially in a multi-tasking environment. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Computer proficiency (Microsoft Windows, Excel, Word and Outlook). Understanding of the veterinary diagnostic market and experience in healthcare or scientific industry is a plus. Bachelor’s degree in a business or scientific discipline is a plus. Career progression within this team could include moving to the regionally aligned outbound inside sales role. In that role you will align by territory with the field sales team to retain, acquire and grow account base. Schedule This role requires schedule flexibility, with the ability to work 8.5 hours between the hours of 7:30 AM and 9:00 PM EST Monday-Friday. Saturdays (8:00 AM - 5:00 PM EST), on a rotating basis. Seniority based schedule preferences are considered, based on business need and availability. Shift-differential pay offered for later shifts. SHIFT INFORMATION - 1st shift - 6:30am - 3:00pm - Monday - Friday As an Instrument Technician, you will work in a fast-paced, agile, and constantly growing environment. Your daily work will consist of performing manufacturing processes, system configuration or troubleshooting and repair tasks supporting a diverse product portfolio of veterinary instruments and supporting technology. Instrument Solutions is a division within the global supply chain organization that supports our companion animal, livestock/poultry, water, and dairy and practice management businesses. We do this by providing high-quality instrumentation and services that enable our teams as well as our end customers to improve the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. In This Role There is a great deal of opportunity for growth and a clearly defined career ladder. As a technician in Instrument Solutions, you assemble and test, new or modified electrical, electro-mechanical, and mechanical components or assemblies across all IDEXX product lines. Strong collaboration with a variety of teams in and outside of the department. Assist in the timely creation and implementation of procedures and documentation to support existing and new products and/or equipment for manufacturing and service operations. Responsible for the execution and/or implementation of equipment preventative maintenance program as well as troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair malfunctioning product. Record test procedures and results on PC, utilizing spreadsheet tools to archive numerical and graphical data, and make recommendations for changes in product or test method. Perform a variety of manufacturing tasks to assemble, package, and inspect products as needed What You Will Need To Succeed We are seeking a positive, open-minded, and flexible team player that is excited to be a part of a high-performing team. Possess strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills. MS office platforms and other relevant software tools and knowledge. Your background and skillset include following a process or standard operating procedure (SOP). Production/manufacturing or related experience preferred, not required Lean manufacturing experience preferred but not required, only the desire to learn and engage in a continuous improvement culture and a “process not person” focus Why IDEXX? As a Janitorial Specialist II, you will be responsible for performing a variety of cleaning tasks in order to keep IDEXX Facilities a high quality, clean, orderly, safe and secure work environment for IDEXX employees, customers and visitors. To ensure that IDEXX Facilities infrastructure, processes, and services meet the evolving needs of the business, we will be a strategic partner and service provider of choice for the business teams. We will strive to achieve operational agility and flexibility, high employee engagement, cost excellence, and safe, sustainable operations. What can you expect? Assist Team Leaders and Supervisor with scheduling of special requests and allocation of available labor to cover for shortages created by sickness and vacations. Is proficient in the cleaning of all area types. Complete all documentation accurately of cleaning task sheets, schedules and projects. Ability to operate floor care equipment used to clean and maintain all types of hard floors, carpeted surfaces, and upholstery. Identify and report problems, assist in routine problem solving and troubleshooting of equipment. Complete basic preventative maintenance and complete clean up procedures for supplies and cleaning equipment. Store all equipment, materials and supplies properly. Mentor, coach and/or train others as needed. Uses experience and knowledge to identify and recommend process improvements Requirements High school diploma or equivalent required. Basic Computer skills in order to complete online training and access information relevant to career and employee life. Ability to follow all safety rules and requirements including the proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) as required. 3 + year’s related experience in the Cleaning Services in a similar work environment and/or a combination of education and experience. Basic Computer skills to complete online training using IDEXX online training tools. Complete assignments with minimal supervision Ability to read as well as understand, and complete written and oral instructions in English. Good organizational skills and detail oriented Ability to follow all safety rules and requirements including the proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) as required. Related education/certification preferred, including certifications for hard floor and carpet maintenance and basic technical cleaning skills. Work under moderate supervision with latitude for independent judgment. Solves problems independently and as part of a team, and assumes responsibility as appropriate Communicate effectively and engage with co-workers and customers as well as provide quality customer service with internal and external customers. Ability to work productively alone or effectively function in a team environment Schedule Monday-Friday Hours 5pm-1:30am. Flexibility to work overtime and weekends as required. Work Environment A safe and pleasant work environment is a key objective within Facilities. Therefore, we will provide and require you to utilize the safety equipment as needed, comply with established safety policies & departmental procedures and maintain a clean & orderly work areas. Ability to stand for extended periods of time is required. Frequently required to stand, use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. As a Janitorial Specialist you will perform variety of facilities-related duties, which may include cleaning, repair, and maintenance work. You will perform outside maintenance, including grounds work, as needed. Schedule: This is a 1st shift position. What You Can Expect In This Role You may be responsible for any or all of the following: You will be asked to complete cleaning tasks including, but not limited to, cleaning and sanitation of restrooms, waste removal, wet and dry cleaning of walls, floors, ceilings, windows, furniture, elevators, water fountains, waste receptacles, corridors, halls, stairwells, lounges, lobbies, locker rooms, offices, cubicles, doors, woodwork, metal, café tables and other tasks as assigned. Understand and follow cleaning procedures for all area types and tasks as assigned. You may collect, separate, and remove solid and recycled waste to the appropriate disposal locations. You will read and follow standard operating procedures, work instructions and guidance documents as required by regulatory standards. You will perform tasks in a safe and responsible manner observing safety and security protocols. You will report and communicate maintenance deficiencies, carpet stains, cleaning projects and safety concerns. You will participate in office moves including breaking down and rebuilding offices, moving totes, computer and phone moves, etc. You will install, maintain and repair facility structures including painting, Sheetrock repair, ceiling repair, door maintenance and repair, etc. You will respond to emergency maintenance requests as needed. You may perform offsite warehouse inventory tracking and storing. You will perform building audits to identify the need and/or opportunity for maintenance and repair. What You Need To Succeed High School degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Associates degree or equivalent preferred. You will have knowledge of building services or trade-specific skills/knowledge. You will have strong communication/customer service skills both verbal and written. You will have strong contract and vendor management skills. You will have the ability to manage and delegate without direct reporting relationships. You will have the ability to prioritize, organize and multi-task. You will have effective team building and commitment skills. You will have the ability to assess and define problems with a variety of variables, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. You will have the ability to read and interpret documents and instructions in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. You will have demonstrated proficiency with mathematical concepts. You will have the ability to write reports and correspondence. Physical Demands Full use of hands including fingers to handle, feel, and use objects, tools and/or controls. Required to stand and walk on average of 5-10 miles per day. Moderate to heavy lifting in excess of 50 pounds as well as the ability to frequently move over 100 pounds on a cart, barrel, bin, or dolly. Specific vision requirements include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to focus. Ability to work overtime hours as required. Weekend hours may be required Work Environment Office, Production, Laboratory and Warehouse environment Occasionally works near moving mechanical parts, works in outside weather conditions, and also occasionally uses a ladder. Moderate noise level You will be required to wear personal protective equipment including protective clothing, hearing protection, and safety glasses. The Laboratory Administrative Coordinator at IDEXX BioAnalytics (IBA) assists with administrative and customer service tasks in a complex work area supporting research pathology services, including anatomic and clinical pathology for IND-enabling preclinical testing and FDA-regulated veterinary clinical trials. Cross-functional team members of this position include, but are not limited to, laboratory technicians and managers, study managers, and pathologists. IDEXX BioAnalytics’ scientific expertise takes a novel approach to the discovery of new diagnostic tests that supplement a robust portfolio of products and services. We partner with Pharma, BioTech, and Academia (the scientific community) to improve animal and human health. This position will be located in our West Sacramento, CA reference lab.. The ideal candidate will have outstanding attention to detail and an ability to do seated computer work for up to 8 hours/day. The schedule for this position is 830am -5pm PST. What You Can Expect From Us Hourly rates targeting $19-22/hour, depending on experience. Opportunity for annual cash bonus and merit pay increase consideration Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day - One 5% matching 401k On the job training and career advancement opportunities (experience NOT required) Additional benefit s including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more! Opportunity to do meaningful work where you positively impact the lives of people and pets all over the world Primary Duties And Responsibilities Provides administrative support to the laboratory team. Performs tasks such as data entry, phone coverage, ordering of office supplies, faxing, processing of purchase orders, invoices, check requests and expense reports, preparing reports, meeting minutes and correspondence. Coordinates meetings and conference calls. Creates and edits documents, spreadsheets, and presentations. Assists with projects of varying scope and complexity. Enters and release test results using the Laboratory Information System. Participates in process improvement activities as instructed. Works with Customer Support Service, the administrative team, laboratory managers and supervisors, and pathologists to achieve team goals. Performs other duties as assigned. Adheres to and models the IDEXX Purpose & Guiding Principles. Education And Experience High School Diploma or equivalent required. A baccalaureate degree preferred. Required Skills And Abilities Attention to details. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Good verbal and written communication skills in English. A positive attitude. Ability to provide good customer support. Ability to read and interpret documents, such as safety rules and standard operating procedures (SOPs). Compliance with standard operating procedures and documentation guidelines. Personal computer skills, including strong typing ability and proficiency with Microsoft Office. Motivation to acquire business skills to meet business needs. Ability to extend and reach with hands and arms and to use hands and fingers. Ability to move and carry 50 pounds. Ability to maintain a reliable and mostly consistent attendance schedule. Why IDEXX? This temporary position is a great way to get your foot in the door at IDEXX! As a temporary Laboratory Assistant at IDEXX, you will be assisting with some of the many tasks vital to the running of our network of Reference Labs. This position will be cross trained our Specimen Processing and parasitology departments. We receive thousands of clinical samples (blood, urine, fecal samples) every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. In this role, you will be helping to sort, tag, and prepare veterinary samples for testing. Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role, Responsibilities Will Vary You might be unbagging, sorting, tagging, or moving clinical samples around the laboratory. You may be restocking supplies, such as chemicals or slide trays. You could be helping to load analyzers with slides of samples. You might be assisting with inventory counts. You could assist with one part of the diagnostic process in a department (swirling samples in Parasitology or creating analyzer slides in Hematology). You will be asked to help in out many ways – and your help is needed! What You Will Need To Succeed You are able to work nights You are reliable – attendance is an essential function of the position. You can read and interpret documents such as safety rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), material safety data sheets (MSDSs), operating and maintenance instructions, government rules, and technical procedures. You must have a demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task. You possess strong initiative and follow through with outstanding attention to detail. As a Temp Laboratory Assistant in the field of Parasitology at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor to one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with a starting pay of $21.80 (including shift differential) IDEXX Reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. Certification not required to work in our labs! In This Role You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment.  You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal, or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in the following area:   Parasitology: Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques.   What You Will Need To Succeed Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. It is not required to work in our lab, but if you are a Veterinary Technician or Medical Laboratory Technician this experience and education would be a plus. You meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a full-time (40 hr / wk), third shift position with shift starting between 11:00pm and midnight Monday - Friday, with a Saturday rotation. During our busy season, you may be asked to stay longer to make sure our turn-around times are met R eliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Why should you consider working a night shift? If you imagine 3rdshift as sitting around trying to stay awake, that is not what you can expect at IDEXX. Our night (3rd) shift is the busiest time in the lab because that is when most samples are received and processed so veterinarians have the results when they get to their offices in the morning. Some benefits of 3rd shift are; work-life balance, flexibility with school schedules, easier commute/less traffic, and at IDEXX – working with a strong, collaborative team, higher shift differential ($), and a pace that will make the night fly by. Calling all people leaders! Exciting times at IDEXX as we are experiencing unprecedented growth. We are hiring for our Elmhurst, Illinois lab and we need YOU! Are you a laboratory professional with leadership experience looking to use your skills in a whole new way? Or a veterinary supervisor or manager looking for career growth and new opportunities? IDEXX is experiencing phenomenal growth, and we're looking for a passionate laboratory leader to join our team. IDEXX focuses on enhancing the lives of people and pets, and this starts with our own employees. We empower them to achieve their goals, focus on continuous improvement, and support the strong collaboration and inclusiveness that exist on our team. You will be joining an innovative and fast-paced work environment with a strong focus on employee culture and development. This is a full-time role with competitive day-one benefits and performance incentives. IDEXX is a global network of laboratories united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care, where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests, technology and tools. In This Role You will be managing teams, including direct Supervisor reports. You will oversee all areas of a Veterinary Diagnostic Lab. You will create and manage budgets. The Assay Dx R&D LCMS group is looking for a dedicated and energetic In-House Service Engineer to join our team and provide critical support for high resolution mass spectrometry and UPLC instruments. The successful candidate will join a team of experienced scientists at the BS, MS and PhD levels. We are looking for a detail-oriented, motivated individual with a strong instrument service background and familiarity with Thermo Fisher systems. What You’ll Do Provide onsite service including minor and major repairs, preventive maintenance, and performance optimization of Orbitrap- and triple quadrupole-based mass spectrometers, and UPLCs from a variety of vendors. Order and maintain inventory of spare parts: ordering, usage, returns, physical count, etc. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to resolve issues and improve processes. Remain up to date on technical bulletins and recommended fixes from vendors. May be required to perform other related duties as required and/or assigned. Experience in a clinical, diagnostic and/or another regulated environment (GLP, or FDA) desired. Strong competency on Windows and other software, network knowledge, electrical/electronics, mechanics, chemistry technology; an analytical thinker with good engineering aptitude and troubleshooting skills. Exercise judgment in setting work priorities, identifying and optimizing next steps. Able to quickly adapt to change with positive and constructive feedback. Work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision. Must be able to stand, bend, and/or kneel for up to two hours at a time. Able to lift to 75 pounds, push and pull equipment, and carry up to 50 pounds for at least 100 feet. Some exposure to biohazards is a possibility as these instruments are used in biohazard environments and encounter human and animal bodily fluids. jobTitle: Long-Term Temporary Laboratory Assistant- General Laboratory(Nights)
jobDescription: What can you expect? Our lab processes thousands of veterinary samples a night, which we receive from veterinary clinics across the US. What type of samples? Glad you asked! We receive blood, urine, and fecal samples; we accession them into our computer system, and then we run diagnostic tests on those samples. The results are then shared back to the Veterinarian, and they can then formulate a treatment plan if the animal is sick. You would be a crucial part of the process of helping to keep pets happy and healthy - how great is that? What can you expect? You Can Expect To Specialize In One Or More Of The Following Areas You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests, and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). Hematology Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques. Urinalysis Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques. Chemistry/Endocrinology Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Parasitology Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques. Immunology/Serology Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG). Microbiology Processing clinical samples for the identification of bacteria and fungi using automated and manual methods. PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) Examining samples for the presence of specific substances (often bacteria) using molecular diagnostic methods. Schedule This is a long-term temporary position where you will be working 40 hours/week. The scheduled shifts will likely have a start time of 11pm or 12am, and the shift would end at 7:30 or 8:30am, depending on your start time. Flexibility to stay longer as needed a huge plus. Weekend Rotations are required. So, one week, you'll work Monday through Friday nights with Saturday and Sunday off; the next week, you'll work 4 weeknights plus Saturday night, and have one night off during the week and Sunday night. The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. What do you need to succeed? Education High School Diploma or equivalent required, 2, 3 or 4-year degree in Science-related field preferred. We'd love to see Certification as a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT - Registered, Licensed or Certified through American Veterinary Medical Association accredited program-AVMA) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) (American Society of Clinical Pathology-ASCP), or military equivalent - but it's not required. Experience Typically 0-1+ years’ experience.  Required Skills And Abilities Laboratory skills, with experience setting up, running and reading lab tests and operating lab instruments. General science background, including hematology/chemistry helpful. Attention to detail. Organized with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Communication skills, both verbal and written. Positive, can-do attitude. Knowledge of Good Clinical Practice (GCP) as appropriate. Supervisory skills, if a lead position. Personal computer skills, including strong typing ability and proficient use of Microsoft Office. Pay: These positions pay $21/hr Physical Demands Extensive sitting, phone and computer use. Capable of standing continuously for up to 2 hours. Extend and reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Hearing acuity sufficient to effectively communicate with customers and Employees via telephone and in person. Ability to communicate verbally on the phone and in person. Fluency in the English language. Extended hours may be required. Some travel required. Work Environment Laboratory environment with potential biohazards present. Potential for exposure to agents known to cause zoonotic disease in humans and the use of potentially hazardous chemicals as defined by the National Hazard Communication Standards. A complete list of such chemicals is available from department supervision. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position.  Adherence to attendance-related policies and expectations is critical to this position. Does this sound like the opportunity for you? Apply Today! No unsolicited Employment Agency resumes are accepted. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran #IND-LAB

What can you expect? Our lab processes thousands of veterinary samples a night, which we receive from veterinary clinics across the US. What type of samples? Glad you asked! We receive blood, urine, and fecal samples; we accession them into our computer system, and then we run diagnostic tests on those samples. The results are then shared back to the Veterinarian, and they can then formulate a treatment plan if the animal is sick. You would be a crucial part of the process of helping to keep pets happy and healthy - how great is that? This position is in our very busy Parasitology Department in our North Grafton, MA lab, and it's working on our overnight shift. (We offer free coffee!) To be clear - working in the Parasitology Department means working with fecal samples. We can learn quite a bit about the health of a pet from what's going on in Fluffy's litter box or Fido's spot in the backyard. In this role, you'll be assisting with the process of preparing the samples and getting them ready to go under the microscope for analysis. This position is fast-paced, busy, always interesting and a great opportunity for you to join our team on a temp basis, and be considered for a direct-hire by IDEXX. This intern position consists of diversified hands-on work with manufacturing equipment. The work includes establishing communications between basic manufacturing equipment and the IDEXX data collection system. This could include electrical, software and documentation disciplines. Activities may include problem solving, simple component fabrication, wiring, minor machine modifications, participation in making updates to work instructions or technical documents, establishing data collection methods, and helping to conduct testing of equipment and communication functions. Basic skills in software installation and configuration, and Microsoft Office are desirable. This intern will work under the mentorship of the Reagent Engineering staff. Job Requirements: Applicants must be at least 18 years of age and must have completed at least one year of college. A technical major related to electrical engineering/technology, industrial engineering or information technology is required. This position has long term potential. The ideal recruit will join the staff after their first or second full year of study, on a part time basis, work full time in the summer and continue part time though the following semester, as a minimum. Scheduling is flexible to accommodate studies. A track record of student success and potential as demonstrated by GPA, research portfolio, prior work experiences and/or the recommendation of a professor preferred. About the IDEXX Internship Program: IDEXX Interns work on a wide variety of challenging projects, gaining valuable professional experience while earning competitive wages. Interns work at our corporate headquarters in Westbrook Maine in a state-of-the-art facility with cutting edge technologies. It’s a fast paced, collaborative environment with a supportive and inclusive culture that promotes innovation, a primary driver of our continued success. In addition to accumulating valuable, real-world professional experience, IDEXX interns have the opportunity to participate in many supplemental activities, including: Lunch & Learn presentations on a variety of professional development topics Intern Poster Session and Intern Presentation Symposium Social mixers and recreational events Desired Abilities, Skills And Experience Familiarity with PLCs, software and related programs Familiarity with Raspberry Pie, Arduino or other communication devices/protocols Basic network knowledge, familiarity with IP addresses, gateways and subnets Basic Electrical knowledge, electrical safety and familiarity with multimeters Demonstrated intellectual curiosity to learn new thing Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical documentation, electrical schematics, specifications, and procedures Ability to manage tasks and projects, overcome obstacles and achieve successful completion and attainment of predefined goals Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical personnel, verbally, in writing and via brief presentations Ability to work independently, and collaboratively as a member of cross-functional teams Ability to learn the technical aspects of the equipment in the area(s) or responsibility Computer skills in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Vision, Project), and other engineering software, as required.

The IDEXX Pathology team of the Americas is seeking a Manager of Anatomic Pathology with strong business acumen and a leadership talent for helping others maximize their potential. This is an exciting opportunity for a veterinary pathologist or pathology leader who is ready for a new challenge in their career. As a Manager of Anatomic Pathology, you will manage and lead a group of dedicated Anatomic Pathologists, navigating the nuances and challenges of leading a virtual team. Application deadline: December 31, 2022. Interviews will not begin until early 2023. In this virtual role, you will… Lead a virtual team of Anatomic Pathologists located primarily in the United States and Canada Respond to customer concerns escalated to your level by team members. Coach and develop your team and promote continued education activities. Plan and manage a budget, as well as policies and workflow procedures. Contribute to the development and execution of the overall strategy for your business unit. Coordinate with and manage the work of outside vendors and contractors. Manage staffing levels to ensure appropriate coverage to meet business needs so that ongoing customer satisfaction is maintained. Identify and implement strategies and efficiencies to enhance customer experience and align with business operations. Perform small and large-scale bulk processing, manufacturing and filtration for experimental and commercial diagnostic products. Operate laboratory instrumentation. Calculate, weigh, measure and check raw materials to assure batches manufactured contain proper ingredients and are prepared within established tolerances. Maintain hand-written and electronic records in compliance with Quality System and Regulatory requirements, Good Manufacturing Practices and Standard Operating Procedures. Assist with in-process testing to assure batches meet specifications. May assist supervisor and team members in determining appropriate scheduling of tasks and optimal inventory levels of raw and work-in-process materials. What You Can Expect In This Role This is a first shift position. Hours could be 7:30 am - 4:00 p.m. Work on assignments that are routine in nature in which ability to recognize deviation and nonconformance to established practice is required. Determine appropriate action using established work instructions and guidelines. Prepare routine small and large scale bulk reagent and buffer formulations according to established recipes as defined in Quality System documentation. Perform routine filtration of manufactured formulations. Use and maintain production and laboratory equipment including, but not limited to; scales, pH meters, centrifuges, mixing/blending equipment, volumetric devices, spectrophotometers and pipets. Identify and communicate deviations and nonconformances to immediate supervisor. Maintain detailed production records in strict adherence to Quality System requirements. Perform planned and unplanned duties as assigned according to scheduled deadlines. What You Will Need To Succeed High School degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Ability to take direction and perform duties receiving general instructions for routine work and detailed instructions for new assignments Ability to follow detailed instructions under direct supervision. Basic to moderate understanding and fluency in the use of computers and software. Ability to read and interpret Quality System documentation, standard operating procedures, work instructions, material safety data sheets, technical procedures and maintenance instructions. Ability to multiply, divide, add and subtract in all units of measure using whole numbers and decimals following basic algebraic rules. Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, proportions and conversions using the metric system. Ability to effectively communicate orally and in written form before groups of peers and managers. Ability to work effectively in a large team environment Why IDEXX? As a Manufacturing Senior Automation Engineer, you will perform a variety of engineering activities in support of manufacturing automation equipment, including machine design, machine controls (PLC/HMI), SCADA, automation software, robotics, machine vision, debug & testing, validating, troubleshooting, process improvements, etc. This is an opportunity to drive results by leading cross-functional efforts across multiple product lines. The ideal candidate operates with a strategic, integrated, and analytical mindset. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will leverage your automation engineering skills and experience in designing, integrating, debugging, testing, validating, and troubleshooting high-speed medical device automation equipment, including process improvements of existing automation, including machine design, automation controls, interfaces, programmable logic controllers (PLC’s), HMIs, automaton software, robotics, machine vision, SCADA, etc. You will c oordinate with engineering, production, and other areas to ensure that automation is correctly integrated into the overall manufacturing process. You will develop and recommend procedures and methods, including preparing technical reports and documentation. You will exercise analytical skills and tools to draw insights from large amounts of manufacturing data. In addition to your current areas of expertise, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skills within a wide variety of disciplines. What You Will Need To Succeed 5+ years of experience designing and building automation and manufacturing equipment. Experienced with high-speed manufacturing, automation, and process control equipment. Strong mechanical engineering machine design or automation controls background with experience designing automated production equipment and an in depth understanding of how a manufacturing and automation system functions. Ability to perform analysis with alternate scenarios and make recommended reasonable changes in the proposed machine/automation to optimize machine/process OEE. Ability to manage tasks and projects through to successful completion and attainment of goals. Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical personnel verbally and in writing. Ability to work collaboratively as members of cross-functional teams. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Computer literacy is essential - Microsoft Windows, Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project), Smartsheet, and other engineering software as required. Ability to prioritize tasks & manage a demanding workload. Display quality orientation and attention to detail. Embraces a growth mindset. Quick learner with the desire and ability to learn and grasp new technology, equipment, and skills. An understanding of data with a Six Sigma mindset. A keen analytical mind and a logical approach to problem solving. Excellent communication and presentation skills to enable understanding and discussion of issues. Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical personnel verbally and in writing. FDA & GMP manufacturing and validation experience prefered. Solidworks and autocad experience preferred. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 10,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. As a Veterinary Laboratory Technician at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive pay and day one benefits. IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. Want to learn more about working at IDEXX? Hear what our current employees have to say in the videos below: https://vimeo.com/663393928 - Why I chose IDEXX - Timothy McElroy, IDEXX Medical Laboratory Tech https://vimeo.com/662998695 - The Best Part About Patient Sample Management - Taylor Gardner, IDEXX Tech https://vimeo.com/662998583 - The Best Part about Parasitology - Stephanie McAdam, Medical Laboratory Technician In This Role You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes, and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries, and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment.  You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal, or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas:   Hematology: Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques.   Chemistry/Endocrinology: Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Urinalysis: Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques.     Cytology: Processing blood and body fluids for microscopic examination by pathologists. Includes slide preparation and staining, utilizing manual and automated counting techniques. Immunology/Serology: Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG).  Parasitology: Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques. PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) : Examining samples for the presence of specific substances (often bacteria) using molecular diagnostic methods. What You Will Need To Succeed You are able to work nights Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a full time, Monday-Friday position Hours are 11:30am-7:00pm This is a temporary position with very high chances of becoming permanent for the right candidate. We are hiring ASAP for this position The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Why IDEXX? An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. In this Role:  You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes, and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries, and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment. .    You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day.   You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures).    You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas:    Hematology: Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques.   Chemistry/Endocrinology: Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Urinalysis : Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques.   What do you need to succeed? A degree in a Science-related field would be helpful, but is not required. Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running, reading lab tests, and operating laboratory equipment You have a general science background, with analytical thinking, and pipetting skills.
