As a Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive benefits. Want to see what it is like to work in our lab? Check out these videos from our lab employees talking about working at IDEXX: https://vimeo.com/idexxcareers Development Opportunities in Labs for Mallory Cormier, Senior Labs Lead https://vimeo.com/663109709%3e Why Taylor Gardner, Medical Laboratory Technician, Chose IDEXX IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role You will be responsible for getting the Quality Control checks completed and all instruments up and running for the night shift. You will be responsible for maintaining the Sysmex, Hamilton, Novus and Beckman analyzers. You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment. You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas: Hematology: Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques. Chemistry/Endocrinology: Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Urinalysis: Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques. Cytology: Processing blood and body fluids for microscopic examination by pathologists.  Includes slide preparation and staining, utilizing manual and automated counting techniques. Immunology/Serology: Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG). What Do You Need to Succeed? You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. You have experience maintaining and using Sysmex, Hamilton, Novus and Beckman analyzers. It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Ideally, you will have experience setting up, running, and reading lab tests, and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes, pipetting and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers). You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. What You Can Expect From Us Competitive hourly rates starting at: $22/hr Evening and Weekend shift differential Opportunity for annual cash bonus and merit pay increase consideration Health/Dental/Vision Benefits Day-One 5% matching 401k On the job training and career advancement opportunities Additional benefits including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more! Opportunity to do meaningful work where you positively impact the lives of people and pets all over the world Schedule The hours for this position are Monday-Friday 3pm-11:30pm, with rotating Saturday shifts. The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Why IDEXX? Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas:   Parasitology: Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques.   Immunology/Serology: Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG).  What You Will Need To Succeed Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. Need local requirements It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a full time (40 hr / wk ), third shift position with hours Tuesday -Saturday 12:00 am - 8:30 am Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. As a Veterinary Laboratory Technologist at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive pay and day one benefits. IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. Want to learn more about working at IDEXX? Hear what our current employees have to say in the videos below: https://vimeo.com/663393928 - Why I chose IDEXX - Timothy McElroy, IDEXX Medical Laboratory Tech https://vimeo.com/662998695 - The Best Part About Patient Sample Management - Taylor Gardner, IDEXX Tech https://vimeo.com/662998583 - The Best Part about Parasitology - Stephanie McAdam, Medical Laboratory Technician In This Role You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes, and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries, and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment.  You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal, or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas:   Hematology: Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques.   Chemistry/Endocrinology: Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Urinalysis: Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques.     Cytology: Processing blood and body fluids for microscopic examination by pathologists. Includes slide preparation and staining, utilizing manual and automated counting techniques. Immunology/Serology: Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG).  Parasitology: Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques. PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) : Examining samples for the presence of specific substances (often bacteria) using molecular diagnostic methods. What You Will Need To Succeed You are able to work nights Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule/Additional Information This is a full-time position-40hrs per week Candidate MUST be able to arrive to work at 8am for opening procedures Work hours are 8am-4:30pm or 10am-6:30pm, on rotation This lab is open all holidays and weekends, shifts are on rotation The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. $127 per month is provided to help with parking/transportation Please be sure that you have looked up the address of the lab before applying to ensure you are able to be at work on time each day! As a Laboratory Assistant for Microbiology at IDEXX, you will be assisting with some of the many tasks vital to the running of our network of Reference Labs. We receive thousands of clinical samples (blood, urine, fecal samples) every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. In this role, you will be helping to sort, tag, and prepare veterinary samples for testing. Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? IDEXX Reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role, Responsibilities Will Vary You might be unbagging, sorting, tagging, or moving clinical samples around the laboratory. You may be restocking supplies, such as chemicals or slide trays. You could be helping to load analyzers with slides of samples. You might be assisting with inventory counts. You could assist with one part of the diagnostic process in a department (swirling samples in Parasitology or creating analyzer slides in Hematology) . You will be asked to help in out many ways – and your help is needed! What You Will Need To Succeed You are willing and able to work overnight. You are reliable – attendance is an essential function of the position . You can read and interpret documents such as safety rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), material safety data sheets (MSDSs), operating and maintenance instructions, government rules, and technical procedures . You must have a demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task. You possess strong initiative and follow through with outstanding attention to detail. You are able to work independently and as a team contributor. You have demonstrated a high level of customer service. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, use of hands, fingers, and arms to handle tools and controls, occasional need to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, lift up to 25lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. As a Process Engineer, you will be leading, or working as a key member of teams, on a variety of projects to improve productivity, quality, yield and cycle time in the manufacture of IDEXX Multiplex products. In this high-volume manufacturing operation, you will be working with both high-speed automated equipment, and custom semi-automated equipment. This role also involves developing change assessments and validation plans for equipment and process changes, as well as leading the continued expansion of the manufacturing process control infrastructure. You will conduct process development activities for new and existing products by utilizing Six Sigma/DMAIC and Lean methodologies. In this role, you will work collaboratively with the automation engineering and equipment maintenance teams to learn processes, equipment, and current process controls, and will then play an integral role in advancing the performance, sustainability and control of the manufacturing operations. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will work both independently and as a member or leader of project teams, on projects and activities to advance operational performance within designated areas of responsibility. A talented, supportive and engaged engineering team will provide the information, training and assistance needed to enable the candidate selected for this role to quickly become involved and effective in their new role. Continuous improvement is an expectation of the organization. As such, the candidate selected for this role will be working on a variety of projects and activities to improve the productivity, quality, cost and cycle time of the products manufactured within the designated area of responsibility. Continuous improvement projects encompass equipment obsolescence and performance improvement upgrades, new equipment procurement and implementation, process improvements, direct material changes, systems upgrades and process controls. In addition to your current areas of expertise, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skills within a wide variety of disciplines. Opportunities for professional development include work experience with a variety of equipment, processes, technologies, systems and controls, experience presenting project proposals and results to a variety of audiences, internal classes and training programs, and tuition assistance for higher education What You Will Need To Succeed A BS in Engineering (chemical, biochemical, mechanical, etc.) Experience using analytical tools such as JMP, Excel, Minitab, SAS, Tableau, and other software tools. Familiarity with, and the ability to develop an in-depth knowledge of Lean and Six Sigma principles and techniques. A solid understanding of manufacturing process control, and familiarity with a variety of process control systems and methods. Ability to understand manufacturing process documentation and perform updates as needed. Ability to read, analyze and interpret standards (e.g., ISO 9000), specifications, professional journals, and technical procedures. Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a member of cross-functional teams. Ability to balance process sustaining responsibilities with participation on multiple strategic projects teams, managing priorities appropriately. Ability to plan and lead strategic projects, and work cooperatively with project teams to navigate through obstacles and achieve project objectives. Ability to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization, using solid verbal, written and presentation skills. Ability to create standard operating procedures (SOP’s) and work instructions which are easily understood by the intended audiences. Ability to learn technical aspects of products in area(s) of responsibility. Strong problem-solving skills, familiarity with the 8D problem solving methodology, and experience working on technical problem-solving teams to identify the root cause of issues, and establish permanent, sustainable solutions. Ability to identify improvement opportunities, define success criteria, quantify variables, collect relevant data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and implement solutions. Knowledge of ISO, GMP, quality audit, safety, and environmental requirements. General computer skills, with proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) and other engineering software as required. Some working knowledge of SAP preferred. You are a continuous learner with a keen intellectual curiosity and an interest in new technologies, systems and methods. You are proficient in analyzing test results, assessing probable failure modes, and developing and executing appropriate corrective action.

You will join a highly-motivated team of Product Transfer Engineers and Technical Writers focused on system integration for assays to ensure readiness for manufacture. This high visibility role will allow you to learn new things and grow while making connections across R&D, Operations and our leadership team. What can you expect? Lead cross functional New Product Development, Product Support, and/or Process Improvement projects of varying complexity to convert small-scale processes into validated, manufacturable and sustainable products. Provide operational input to Core Teams with a structured, process-oriented and quality-driven approach. Understand what will be sustainable in manufacturing and prepare timing, cost, and material estimates for production. Ensure production infrastructure and process is in place to execute validation activities. Ensure decisions are made to support product objectives at the most appropriate level with attention to relevant risks. Use a project management approach: determine timelines, develop plans, work with leadership and influence cross-functionally to best meet project objectives. Provide reports and project status updates to senior management, stakeholders, review boards, and others, highlighting successes, concerns, milestones, resolved issues and other relevant project information. What do you need to succeed? Bachelor’s Degree in a Scientific Discipline required. Master’s degree a plus. Project Management Certification a plus. Lean Six Sigma Certification a plus. 4+ years of relevant experience within the assay environment. Skills And Abilities Experience in successful transition, integration and scale-up of new or improved products from R&D to Operations. Strong understanding of manufacturing, test, documentation and quality requirements for in vitro diagnostic products. Strong project/program management skills with demonstrated use of portfolio and/or project management tools Experience prioritizing a large number of projects and tasks at various stages of development. Ability to communicate project status and risks effectively to stakeholders at all levels. Strong presentation, meeting management and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain trusting relationships across the organization. Leads with agility when presented with challenging situations; maintains an open-minded approach to problem solving. Excellent analytical skills; ability to support plans and initiatives with system-generated data. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 10,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. jobTitle: North America - Account Based Marketing Manager
jobDescription: Our Corporate and Strategic Accounts Marketing Team seeks a highly motivated and experienced Account Based Marketing Manager to lead programs and strategies to support the growth of our largest and most strategic accounts. This role is designed for excellence as a Marketing Manager not a Sales Manager role. In this role, you will plan and execute Account-based Marketing (ABM) programs, develop C-suite customer advocacy initiatives, build thought leadership and executive engagement activities in close coordination with our Marketing and Sales teams. What You Will Do Creation of account specific revenue generating plans tailored for our largest and most strategic accounts. Alignment of plans with account teams and success tracking. Work with corporate account marketing teams and marketing Centers of Excellence (COEs) on tailored account programs. Partner in development and execution. Collaborate with account teams to unlock internal customer channels for marketing programs. Develop thought leadership initiatives for Global Accounts. Support RFP building and storytelling. What’s in it for you? Are you a Vet Tech looking to grow your career in laboratory diagnostics? Are you a science enthusiast who loves the idea of working in a fast-paced environment, helping animals? As a Pathology Coordinator (Medical Laboratory Technician I) at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will be responsible for maintaining IDEXX’s whole slide scanners, assuring digital slide and patient requisition image quality for the Pathology team. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork and quality and offers opportunities for personal growth. Check Out What Our Employees Have To Say Want to learn more about what it is like to work in Histology at IDEXX. https://vimeo.com/662998240 https://vimeo.com/663110312 https://vimeo.com/663393248 Schedule: Tuesday-Saturday 2pm-10:30pm Pay: $20-22/hour range based on experience, plus shift differential. What can you expect? You will assure accurate and timely delivery of casework (and collateral materials) to remote pathologists You will be responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting virtual microscopy (VM) systems which provide remote viewing & digital slide analysis capability to pathologists You will organize and archives pending and completed VM cases You will create and maintain VM system standard operating procedures You will track VM system errors You will troubleshoot VM system problems with pathologists, labs, vendors, IT and others You will run regular meetings and meets with vendors You will set up and train users Education High School Diploma or equivalent work experience required. Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Science-related field preferred. Experience Typically 0-1+ years’ experience. Certification as a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT - Registered, Licensed or Certified through American Veterinary Medical Association accredited program-AVMA, Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) (American Society of Clinical Pathology-ASCP), Histotechnician for histology-specific (HT) (ASCP), or military equivalent a plus. Required Skills And Abilities Laboratory skills, with experience setting up, running and reading lab tests and operating lab instruments. General science background, including hematology/chemistry helpful. Strong computer skills - MS Office (i.e. Word, Excel, etc.) Database/Access experience preferred Ability to devise tracking systems and efficient reporting Ability to learn to update internal websites Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and follow-up Effective project administration skills and/or task management skills. Project management skills a plus. Strong written and verbal communication skills as well as interpersonal skills. Ability to deliver trainings and presentations Ability to work independently, as a team member, and as a team leader Ability to develop standards and practices within discipline Ability to identify, implement and maintain best practices (continuous improvement) Client centered focus (internal and external) Physical Demands Extensive sitting, phone and computer use. Capable of standing continuously for up to 2 hours. Extend and reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Hearing acuity sufficient to effectively communicate with customers and Employees via telephone and in person. Ability to communicate verbally on phone and in person. Extended hours may be required . Some travel required. Work Environment This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. We are hiring IMMEDIATELY for Sample Management Technicians! Same-day interviews! No prior experience needed! What do you need to succeed in this position? Positive attitude and enthusiasm Eagerness to learn High energy (in a runner position, you will get your steps in!) Wanting to get your foot into the laboratory field Can work nights You thrive in a high-volume, fast-paced environment Entry-level positions start at $21/hr! We receive thousands of clinical samples every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. As a Sample Management Technician , (SMT), also referred to as a Specimen Processor or Specimen Accessioner, you'd be helping to sort, tag, and prepare the samples for testing. The samples that we work with are blood, urine, fecal samples, and biopsies that we receive from the vet clinics (no animals on-site!) Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? This is a full-time position with excellent, day-one benefits and a generous shift differential. IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role You will receive, prepare, and accession veterinary samples (blood, urine, feces, and biopsies) for laboratory analysis and testing. You can expect to remove specimens from transport bags and enter specimen data into a computer tracking system. You will rack and bundle prepared samples for delivery to each testing department. You will assist other lab personnel with specimen storage and ensuring that Turn Around Times (TAT's) are met.   From day one, you'll have full autonomy in your work, but you'll also get full support when you need it. You will play a critical role as part of a successful team that is proud of the work they do and motivated by the common purpose in helping veterinarians quickly diagnose illness and disease in pets and animals. What You Will Need To Succeed You are able to work nights You have a positive attitude and love to bring this energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues, whether working independently or as a team contributor. You are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume work environment. You value working at the highest levels of accuracy, safety, and quality You are able to read, understand and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), including safety and quality procedures. You have a familiarity and comfort with using computers for data entry. You are able to prioritize and multi-task, demonstrate excellent attention to detail on the job, and can work reliably and precisely Your customer service skills are top-notch Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is the full-time, night shift position, with scheduled shifts Monday-Friday11:00pm-7:30am, with rotating Saturday shifts. Weekend shifts are required. The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Pay The starting rate of pay for this position is $21/hr. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. The Artificial Intelligence team in R&D is seeking a Principal Data Engineer to design and manage data pipelines and machine learning operations infrastructure and applications in support of high impact data science initiatives. The successful Data Engineering candidate will work with ML research scientists across IDEXX R&D to enable our product related to be leveraged for ML modeling. This will be accomplished by designing and implementing end-to-end data workflows for ML model building and monitoring for complex products that include imaging, clinical and operational solutions. Additional data engineering work will impact search/retrieval, processing, tagging, and publishing of curated data sets, with an eye towards improving ML model performance over time. You will join a team of talented data scientists, analysts, and data engineers driving cutting edge AI innovation in veterinary care. This is an exciting role that will interact with many of IDEXX’s core data streams, including new streams emerging from R&D innovation pipelines. If you enjoy complex data engineering challenges, consider this role! Performs the purchasing of a variety of parts for the site including parts for Manufacturing Automations, Production Equipment, Utilities and projects. Receive, count, and inspect equipment, parts and materials to ensure accurate quantity and quality. Make periodic inventory counts of parts room items to ensure proper identification and re-supply needs. Maintain records, quotations, invoices, memos, letters, etc. Prepare reorder requests. Maintain the parts rooms in a clean and orderly fashion and in accordance with standard accepted warehouse procedures. Locate and maintain the records of sources/vendors for equipment parts. Review and ensure that written/technical specifications for parts, materials, and equipment are accurate and conform to good/accepted purchasing practices and to IDEXX standards. Fundamental knowledge and experience of electrical/mechanical pneumatics spare parts and components. Interact with Engineering and Operations teams at a highly technical level. Prepare equipment parts technical specifications. Maintain required purchasing records. Communicate effectively/professionally with both internal and external parties, verbally and in writing. Evaluate the needs and estimate future supply requirements for a variety of parts and related items. Select and recommend the purchase of routinely used materials and supplies. As a Product Support Engineer, you will work on problem solving efforts for a portfolio of veterinary diagnostic products in the Animal Healthcare Industry, primarily focusing on our Urinalysis, Digital Cytology, Diagnostic Imaging, IVLS and VSS lines of business. You will work collaboratively on cross-functional teams covering a variety of engineering disciplines. The ideal candidate operates with a systemic, integrated and analytical mindset. What You Can Expect In This Role You will holistically approach problem solving for products as complete integrated systems. You will characterize systems by breaking them down into their component parts and mapping out how each function will work within the overall system to make sure products will operate as intended. You will exercise analytical skills and tools to draw insights from large amounts of customer data. You will manage overall systems throughout post-launch life cycle, ensuring each system is functioning to product requirements. You will interface and collaborate with a wide variety of colleagues across the company. In addition to your current areas of expertise, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skills within a wide variety of disciplines. What You Need To Succeed A Bachelor of Science in Engineering (systems engineering, biomedical, electromechanical, etc). or equivalent combination of education and experience is required You are a continuous learner who embraces a growth mindset. You have strong technical problem-solving and critical thinking abilities. You possess a good understanding of life and biological sciences. Ability to manage tasks and projects through to successful completion and attainment of goals. You can work with cross-functional teams. The Roswell Product Support – Chemistry Team is looking for a motivated and creative scientist to aid in the improvement and scale up of their manufacturing processes. The ideal candidate will have manufacturing experience in the food/pharma/fine chemistry industry. The individual will participate on a technically focused team, execute experiments and/or follow standard protocols at the laboratory bench to inform decisions or recommendations. Will use advanced knowledge to analyze, interpret or make deductions from varying facts or circumstances. Will also prepare solutions and reagents, communicate and present to colleagues. Will be self-motivated and able to work autonomously. What You Can Expect In This Role Prepares materials, performs experiments, gathers data, carries out analysis and reaches conclusions. May also design experiments. Documents experiments and other lab or production activities. Prepares reports and summaries. Presents results and conclusions. Maintains appropriate records. Participates on and may manage teams, planning and organizing team activities. Orders and maintains equipment and work area. Collaborates and communicates with colleagues and others in related areas to provide work support, exchange information and ensure efficient processes. May produce and/or test reagents and final products and perform other production-related activities. Maintains knowledge of products and procedures, developments in the field and industry and regulatory environment. Adheres to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. May participate in conferences, webinars and seminars to continue to develop knowledge base. Adheres to and models the IDEXX Purpose & Guiding Principles. What You Will Need To Succeed Bachelor’s Degree with 5 years’ experience OR MSc degree in scientific discipline with 2 years’ experience Experience with small scale or pilot plant scale reactions and manufacturing of solutions or knowledge of coating technology preferred. Laboratory bench and instrumentation skills. Analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently and cooperatively as part of a team. Organizational skills and ability to plan work. Takes initiative and is accountable (shows ownership); focuses on task at hand; detail oriented. Adaptable. Ability to work well under pressure and handle the stress of deadlines. Why IDEXX? As a Production Specialist, you will perform a variety of manufacturing tasks producing high-quality medical diagnostic products while maintaining a clean and safe work environment. You will have the opportunity to cross-train in multiple work centers and gain new skills that can help you advance in your career. You will operate under 5S & Lean Manufacturing principles and ISO standards. You can make a difference by producing innovative products that keep people and animals healthy. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. You can learn more about working with this team here . Shift Information: 1st Shift (6:30 am – 3:00 pm) Monday - Friday We have multiple positions open - apply today! What You Can Expect In This Role You will read, analyze, and interpret manufacturing and quality control documents, technical procedures, and government regulations. You will have the chance to operate a variety of machines on a rotating basis. This will include set-up operation, clean-up, change-over, troubleshooting, and/or minor repair for manufacturing equipment in the work center. You'll use basic math skills add, subtract, multiply, and divide into all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. You will be working with a team; strong communication skills are required. You may have to provide production & process training to other employees. What You Will Need To Succeed If you have some manufacturing or production experience that is great, but we are willing to train you to be successful in this role - you just need a desire to learn. You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. You are able to meet the physical requirements that go with working on the production floor – standing for 2hr+, sitting, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, occasionally climb, kneel, or bend, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. As an IDEXX Radiologist you will use your expertise to provide critical diagnostic information to our customers, enabling veterinarians and pet owners to make the most informed decisions for the care of their animals. IDEXX radiologists can work from anywhere, leveraging our technology platform to read cases and submit reports from any location. Across IDEXX, there is a vibrant energy that inspires caring and committed people to come together to advance the standard of care for the animals we love around the globe. IDEXX Telemedicine can work for you. Whether you are looking for peer collaboration, contributions to the profession, educational outreach, additional income, flexibility, better work/life balance, or career development, we can provide the avenue to make it happen. Visit our talent page to learn more about our team. We are always looking to gain a deep understanding of what matters to radiologists. As such, we would love your feedback. Please complete the survey to share what matters to you. As an IDEXX Radiologist you will… …have Global Collaboration We are a large, collaborative team of radiologists spanning five continents. You are never alone; consultation with other radiologists on the team is always possible. …use Innovative Technology We use an innovative platform that allows users the flexibility and technology to read cases and dictate reports in a format that works best for them. We have an entire R&D team dedicated to continuous improvement. Our platform allows collaboration, personal preferences, and ease of use all geared toward enhancing the customer and radiologist experience. …participate in Continuing Education Our team regularly attends radiology and Advanced Imaging Rounds hosted by Dr. Don Thrall and other recognized educators. Our team regularly contributes to the radiology community by hosting resident CE events, case blogs, and monthly resident rounds, with the goal of strengthening the community with each interaction. We also encourage participation in conferences, and, as an employee, IDEXX will reimburse your eligible expenses. …Advance Your Learning We are dedicated to supporting the veterinary diagnostic imaging community and you. Our relationships start with students and interns and extend to IDEXX sponsored resident training through several university collaborations. You will be supported in any desire you have, to participate in research, give lectures, and pursue your specialty. You are also invited to participate in our journal club and learning platform. …have Readily Available Support Our 24-hour specialist and IT support teams are available should you need them. Specialist Support and our Telemedicine Support Veterinarians communicate with referring clinics on technical problems or case inconsistencies, allowing you to focus on what you do best! …receive Mentorship From day one, you will be assigned an experienced and knowledgeable mentor who will help guide and support you throughout your introduction to our team. You will also have a manager and team surrounding you to support your experience. …create an Optimized Schedule We work with you to determine your schedule. Whether you’d like to be a consultant, full-time, or part-time employee, you will collaborate with our dedicated workforce manager to design an optimized schedule, which could even include split shifts to accommodate your lifestyle. What You Need To Succeed Board-certified or residency trained radiologist (DACVR, DECVDI, FANZCVS (Radiology)) with a passion for helping people and pets. Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Analytical, can prioritize, and excel at problem-solving. We receive thousands of clinical samples every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet.  As a Sample Management Technician you'll be helping to sort, tag, and prepare the samples for testing.  The samples that we work with are blood, urine, fecal samples, and biopsies that we receive from the vet clinics (no animals on-site!)  Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick.  Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that?  This is a full-time position with excellent, day-one benefits, and a generous shift differential. IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. Want to learn more about positions in our Sample Management Department? Check out what our employees have to say: The Best Part About Patient Sample Management - Taylor Gardner, Medical Laboratory Technician The Best Part About Working in Patient Sample Management - Amber Austin, PSM Advice for Patient Sample Management Roles from Amber Austin, Specimen Processor In This Role You will receive, prepare, and accession veterinary samples (blood, urine, feces, and biopsies) for laboratory analysis and testing.   You can expect to remove specimens from transport bags and enter specimen data into a computer tracking system.     You will rack and bundle prepared samples for delivery to each testing department.    You will assist other lab personnel with specimen storage and ensuring that Turn Around Times (TAT's) are met.     From day one, you'll have full autonomy in your work, but you'll also get full support when you need it.  You will play a critical role as part of a successful team that is proud of the work they do and motivated by the common purpose in helping veterinarians quickly diagnose illness and disease in pets and animals.  What You Will Need To Succeed You are willing and able to work the overnight shift You have a positive attitude and love to bring this energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues, whether working independently or as a team contributor.  Data entry skills preferred. You are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume work environment.   You value working at the highest levels of accuracy, safety, and quality    You are able to read, understand and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), including safety and quality procedures.    You have a familiarity and comfort with using computers for data entry.   You are able to prioritize and multi-task, demonstrate excellent attention to detail on the job, and can work reliably and precisely  Your customer service skills are top-notch  Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.  This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals.  What You Can Expect From Us Hourly rate is $21.70 (includes shift differential) Opportunity for annual cash bonus Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day - One 5% matching 401k On the job training and career advancement opportunities (experience NOT required) Additional benefit s including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more! The scheduled shifts will likely have a start time between 11:00pm and midnight , and the shift would end at 7:30 am - 8:30 am , depending on your start time. Flexibility to stay longer as needed a huge plus.  Weekend Rotations are required. So, one week, you'll work Monday through Friday nights with Saturday and Sunday off; the next week, you'll work 4 weeknights plus Saturday night, and have one night off during the week and Sunday night. Saturday hours are 9:00 pm - 5:30 am. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. At IDEXX, you can be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. As a Specimen Processor, or Sample Management Technician, you will be helping to track samples as they come into the lab for clinical testing. This work helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets across the United States. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork and quality and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive benefits and shift differential. Schedule This is a full time, day shift position, with hours Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:00pm Rotating Saturdays. Saturday hours are 2pm - 10:30pm. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. Adherence to attendance-related policies and expectations is critical to this position. What can you expect? You will receive and prepare samples for laboratory analyses and testing that diagnose various pet illnesses, injuries and diseases. You can expect to remove specimens from transport bags and split as needed for multiple testing.You will enter data about the specimens into a computer tracking system. You will also rack and bundle prepared samples for delivery to each testing department. In this role, accuracy, safety and quality are extremely important, so you will be expected to read, understand and follow applicable Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), including safety and quality procedures. Additionally, you will assist other lab personnel with specimen storage and ensuring Turn Around Times (TAT's) are met.You may be cross-trained to perform other basic laboratory technician duties, which could give you a window into other career opportunities at IDEXX. Job Qualifications What do you need to succeed? High School Diploma or equivalent required, 2, 3 or 4 year degree in Science-related field preferred. Typically 0-1 Years of related experience. Preferably strong typing/data entry experience and/or experience with laboratory sample processing. General science background, including hematology/chemistry helpful. Attention to detail. Organized with ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Positive, can-do attitude. Basic math, interpretive and analytical skills. Data entry skills required. Personal computer skills, including strong typing ability and proficient use of Microsoft Office. Physical Demands Extensive sitting, phone and computer use. Capable of standing continuously for up to 2 hours. Extend and reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers. Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crouch. May be required to lift, move and carry up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Hearing acuity sufficient to effectively communicate with customers and Employees via telephone and in person. Ability to communicate verbally on phone and in person. Fluency in the English language. Extended hours may be required. Some travel required. Work Environment Laboratory environment with potential biohazards present. Potential for exposure to agents known to cause zoonotic disease in humans and use of potentially hazardous chemicals as defined by the National Hazard Communication Standards. A complete list of such chemicals is available from department supervision. Does this sound like the opportunity for you?Apply Today! #IND-LAB No unsolicited Employment Agency resumes are accepted. You have a familiarity and comfort with using computers for data entry. You are able to prioritize and multi-task, demonstrated excellent attention to detail on the job and can work reliably and precisely Your customer service skills are top-notch Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. jobTitle: Senior Associate Scientist - R&D Product Support
jobDescription: We are seeking a Senior Associate Scientist to join the R&D Product Support team where the candidate will p erform a variety of scientific activities to support the current and future Catalyst product portfolio . The role provides a chance to participate on a technically focused team whose work directly affects our customers. The successful candidate will execute experiments and/or follow standard protocols at the laboratory bench to inform decisions or recommendations. Uses knowledge to analyze, interpret or make deductions from varying facts or circumstances. Communicates and presents to colleagues. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills as well as familiarity with an industrial laboratory setting. To be s uccessful in this role the candidate should be highly motivated, detail oriented, and excel in a highly collaborative and multi-disciplinary environment. They will also be expected to consistently apply discretion and sound judgement towards the work they undertake. Degree of complexity and autonomy is dependent on level of experience. What will you do? Prepares materials, performs experiments, gathers data, carries out analysis and reaches conclusions. May also design experiments. Documents experiments and other lab or production activities. Prepares reports and summaries. Presents results and conclusions. Maintains appropriate records. Work independently and cooperatively as part of a team and work cross-functionally on multi-disciplinary projects. Prepare and communicate presentations, results, and conclusions, both verbal and written, to key stakeholders and team members. Collaborates and communicates with colleagues and others in related areas to provide work support, exchange information and ensure efficient processes. May produce and/or test reagents and final products and perform other production-related activities. Maintains knowledge of products and procedures, developments in the field and industry and regulatory environment. Adheres to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. Orders and maintains equipment and work area. What do you need to succeed? Bachelors degree in biology, biochemistry or chemistry, or equivalent combination of education and experience required. FMEA (Change Effect Assessment) experience a plus. Minimum of 3 years laboratory bench and instrumentation experience required, with understanding of biological and chemical principles and concepts as they relate to commercial products. Adaptable with an ability to multi-task and adjust priorities as necessary. Analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to maintain accurate and clear documentation. Ability to work independently and cooperatively as part of a team. Goal and detail oriented with organizational skills and ability to plan work. Takes initiative and is accountable (shows ownership); focuses on task at hand. Ability to work well under pressure and handle the stress of deadlines. Proficient with MS Office. Familiarity with JMP or other statistical software a plus. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. As a Senior Automation Engineer & Project Manager you will be managing automation projects for a portfolio of veterinary diagnostic products in the Animal Healthcare industry. You will lead efforts in sourcing and acquiring new equipment as a member of a cross functional engineering team that collectively provides controls mechanical and process engineering support. Seeking Engineer experienced in Automated Electromechanical/Mechatronic equipment in the manufacturing environment. Experience sought includes Project management, working with state of the art automation, hands on experience working with various types of automation utilizing robotics, pneumatic, servos, plastic welding, lasers, plc’s. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role Develop and maintain project schedules Manage all aspect of project such as meetings, timelines, change orders, vendors etc. Manages automation projects, sourcing outside vendors to build final products. Manage outsourced vendors involved in design projects. Develops and maintains relationships with various stakeholders and vendors. Record and resolve problems / issues, implement changes to a project and document meetings Identify project risk and mitigate as needed. Report out on projects and updates around delays or changes in scope. Mentor other team members in project management Responsible for communicating with various group such a management, production, quality control and others. Develops plans to automate individual manufacturing steps or entire processes as needed. Computer skills in MS Office applications (Project Management software, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) and other engineering software as required. Some working knowledge of SAP preferred. Travel Limited but as needed for project management Will support other engineering duties as needed What You Will Need To Succeed You have a BS in Engineering of any sort (Project Management, Mechanical, Electromechanical, Systems Engineering, or Electrical etc.) or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience supporting and designing automated systems. Excel working in a team environment. You have a successful track record working with cross-functional development teams. You are proficient in analyzing test results, assessing probable failure modes, and developing and executing appropriate corrective action. You have project management skills and project scheduling skills You are skilled at using analytical tools such as Matlab, JMP and Computer aided design Strong skills using SOLIDWORKS, Enterprise PDM, AUTOCAD (CAD) software tools. You have 3D printing knowledge or experience. You are a continuous learner who embraces a growth mindset. 5s or Six sigma training or experience Why IDEXX? As a Senior Automation Project Manager at IDEXX, you will be responsible for providing leadership on projects from initiation through delivery and throughout the life of the project. These projects are in support of producing high quality medical diagnostic products, while maintaining a clean and safe work environment. You will have the opportunity to cross-train in multiple work centers and gain new skills that can help you advance in your career. You will operate under 5S & Lean Manufacturing principles and ISO standards, Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) regulations. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. In This Role You will work to solve problems using root cause analysis, and recommended corrective actions. You will analyze and compile engineering data to draw conclusions. You will coordinate and manage automation engineering activities in support of production machinery including -machine controls, interfaces, programmable logic controllers (PLC’s), software, and data tracking. You will coordinate equipment improvement designs and implements improvements. You will manage outsourced vendors involved in design projects. You will create project plans, gathers resources, implements projects. You will manage projects and be accountable for successful project delivery while coordinating activities to ensures effective communication within the project team. As a Senior Data Engineer on the VetLab Portfolio Team, you will design, develop, and implement business intelligence solutions to help support executive-level strategy. 100% Remote for anyone based in the US About IDEXX Veterinary Software IDEXX Veterinary Software is the fastest growing part of IDEXX, with technology platforms that help veterinary practices run their businesses.  If you are in the veterinary world, you know that IDEXX is a global leader in pet healthcare innovation – with diagnostic, software, and data solutions for practicing veterinarians around the world.  If you are a pet owner and have ever visited your local veterinary clinic there is a really good chance that your practitioner was leveraging our software, diagnostic equipment or reference labs. If you are not a pet owner, that’s OK; we would still love to hear from you! About The Job We are looking for a Senior .NET Developer for our Data Integration Squad. The primary mission of our integration squad is to connect practice management data to all of the downstream people and systems that can use it to contribute to better results for our pets. Our stack is fairly heterogenous in that we have applications written in .Net, Java, and a number of other technologies. We are deployed directly in clinics as well as in the cloud. We leverage PaaS capabilities on both AWS and Azure to get the job done. Our engineers are experienced, dedicated, diverse and extremely clever. Lastly, while we have the backing of an international organization in IDEXX, we operate fairly autonomously, more like a startup. We are looking for someone who can both enhance existing solutions and develop greenfield offerings on behalf of our product partners. Anyway, it’s a pretty cool space.   In This Role You will l ead and contribute to the design, development, implementation, test ing and deployment of new and existing features for the IDEXX Integration Platform. You will  l ead technical initiatives, projects, rollouts, and phased releases . You will c ontribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback. You will c onduct code reviews and provide recommendations on code improvement. You will e stablish and champion architectural standards best practices that enable automated test and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). You will a dvocate for continuous improvements to a team’s day-to-day processes and support a culture of learning . What You Will Need To Succeed You have spent 5 or more years building full stack or high scale, mission critical systems. You are proficient with C#, with a good knowledge of .NET, .NET Core and its ecosystems (Experience with Java is a plus). You have deployed applications to a cloud environment, preferably Azure or AWS. You have experience designing RESTful services and APIs. You have strong computer science fundamentals gained through bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. Preferred Qualifications You have experience with code version control systems. Y ou have knowledge of end-to-end DevOps practices using tools like Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions or Jenkins. We value the experiences that individual team members add to our culture. Please do apply even if you meet only some of the requirements.

As a Senior Process Engineer, you will lead process engineering activities in support of manufacturing medical diagnostic products, including developing, improving, troubleshooting, and validating manufacturing processes and equipment. In addition, you will spearhead and support value engineering projects to increase production efficiency, capacity, reduce cost, improve quality, and improve equipment OEE. This is an opportunity to drive results by leading cross-functional efforts across multiple product lines. The ideal candidate operates with a strategic, integrated, and analytical mindset. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance and continuous improvement. What You Can Expect In This Role You will holistically approach problem-solving for products as complete integrated systems. You will leverage your skills and experience in process engineering to investigate root causes and develop recommended solutions. You will characterize production processes by breaking them down into their function blocks and map out how each process works within the overall system to ensure the process operates efficiently and as intended. You will exercise analytical skills and tools to draw insights from large amounts of manufacturing data. In addition to your current areas of expertise, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow your skills within a wide variety of disciplines. What You Will Need To Succeed 5+ years of experience manufacturing process engineering. BS in Engineering or equivalent experience. Highly knowledgeable and experienced with manufacturing, automation, and process engineering. Engineering background with solid troubleshooting, diagnostics, and process improvement skills. Highly proficient with analyzing and organize data to present in a form that aids root cause analysis, including assessing probable failure modes, and developing and executing appropriate corrective action. Proficient in using root cause analysis tools like 8D, FMEA, 5 Why’s. Experienced with equipment and process validations (IQ/OQ/PQ). Ability to evaluate, recommend, and implement process, machine, and design improvements to production equipment and procedures. Highly skilled with solving practical problems and dealing with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited information is available. Experience with statistical process control (SPC), manual and automated data collection, and data analytics using software tools like Excel, JMP, Tableau. High work ethic and self motivated with the drive and tenacity to get the job done. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to perform well both independently and in teams. Successful track record working with cross-functional development teams. Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities. Display quality orientation and attention to detail. Quick learner with the desire and ability to learn and grasp new technology, equipment, and skills. Ability to write clear and concise technical reports. Have flexibility with requirements and system changes. Continuous learner who embraces a growth mindset. Medical Device or Biotech related industry experience working within a GMP, FDA, and ISO environment is a plus. LEAN Six Sigma Black Belt Certification is a plus. Why IDEXX? The Senior R&D Process Development Engineer is an exciting opportunity to lead the development and scale up of manufacturing processes for our cutting-edge In vitro Diagnostics. The Process Development Engineer will play a crucial role in solving complex multidisciplinary problems in consumable development and reagents spotting and drying to support the company’s proprietary Molecular and Immunoassay Diagnostics process. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in engineering or science discipline and have experience in manufacturing process development. They should possess the technical precedents needed to solve complex process related problems through the use of both engineering modeling & analysis along with experimentation. The Senior Process Engineer will lead cross functional technical teams in development of new manufacturing processes and transfer them to IDEXX Operations. They will be responsible for all aspects of process develop including requirements definition, process design, verification and validation and will deliver key outputs including process maps, pFMEAs, manufacturing documents, in process test methods and specifications. What Can You Expect Lead cross-functional technical teams in development of new manufacturing processes and transfer them to IDEXX Operations. Responsible for all aspects of process develop including requirements definition, process design, verification and validation and will deliver key outputs including process maps, pFMEAs, manufacturing documents, in process test methods and specifications. Performs variety of process engineering activities for Molecular and Immunoassay Diagnostics process development. Collaborate with R&D teams and Operation to develop processes to meet product design and manufacturing requirements. Develops manufacturing processes and makes feasibility and pilot lots for new product development. Develops specifications associated with process output and determine test methods for specification compliance. Identify process scale-up and manufacturing risks and implement mitigation strategies for successful process scale-up. Recommends and justifies new equipment/technologies for improving existing process or establishing new process for solving challenges of new product development. Generates SOPs/work instructions and conducts training of personnel in the methods and techniques used. Utilizes Lean, Six Sigma and other quality and reliability improvement techniques in ongoing work and participates in related projects. What Do You Need To Succeed Ph.D. 0-3 years' experience, MS with 3-5 years’ experience or BS with 5-7 years’ degree in an engineering or science discipline including Chemical, mechanical, Chemistry, biochemistry, or a related technical field. Experience with implementation of biological assay (Immunoassays or nucleic acid based) in microfluidic platforms is a plus. As an R&D Scientist on our Platform Architecture Team , you will join our cross-functional research & development team focused on designing immunoassay & molecular diagnostics to advance our product pipeline. As a critical member of the team, the Scientist will incorporate next-gen biomarkers into new consumable platforms by leading design teams, testing concept designs, and communicating results across the organization. The successful candidate will be motivated, inquisitive, and excel in a highly collaborative and multi-disciplinary environment. What will you do? Collaborate across our organization to receive concept designs and direct evolution through early design phases to demonstrate assay feasibility. Research, test, and characterize new materials and formulations to support assay design and consumable development. Optimize assay designs to meet performance and manufacturing requirements. Plan and execute laboratory research independently and in collaboration with others, working with small project teams to direct experiment design and determine next experimental steps. Document methods, techniques, and outcomes related to design history. Work cross-functionally with multiple project teams, prioritizing work accordingly. Accomplish project goals in a timely manner and with a high degree of quality. What do you need to succeed? Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science/Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Biochemistry or Biology, Master’s or PhD would be an asset. PhD with 0-3 years of experience, Master’s with 3-5 years of experience or Bachelor’s with 5-7 years of experience. Strong initiative, flexibility, positive attitude, and the ability to function effectively in a highly collaborative team environment. Excellent verbal, technical writing and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to maintain accurate and clear documentation. Good presentation skills. Experience in assay design and / or coating technology (formulation, application and characterization) is strongly desired. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. jobTitle: Senior Research Associate Rare Reagent Development
jobDescription: The Rare Reagent Development Team is looking for a Senior Research Associate to participate in the development of rare reagents for growing and expanding diagnostic lines of new products and assist in improvements of existing products . The successful applicant will be a highly motivated and agile scientist with a strong desire to develop cutting-edge products for companion animal care. What will you do each day ? Design: You will w ork front lines at the bench preparing new liquid phase and solid phase reagents. Designing and performing various experiments at the interfaces of organic chemistry , biochemistry , and material science. Experimental designs will be directed at improving reagents, their assay performance, stability , and manufacturability. Experiment: You will work with small organic molecules, peptides, and various proteins. You will prepare, purify, and analytically characterize a variety of conjugates (biological and surface based) . Validate: You may produce and/or test reagents and final products as well as perform other production-related activities. Document: You are expected to maintain detailed records of your experimental work, prepare presentations, and discuss your results in group and interdepartmental meetings. Collaborate: You will participate in different stages of the reagent design and development process , from the conceptual design of reagents through development and transfer of the reagents into a manufacturing environment. Learn: You will develop and m aintain deep knowledge of IDEXX products and procedures, and learnings in the field , industry , and regulatory environment s . You will ensure all work a dhere s to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. Grow: You m ay participate in conferences, webinars , and seminars to continue to develop your scientific knowledge base. What will you need to succeed? Experience Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, biochemistry, chemical engineering , or material science or equivalent combination of education and experience required. MS with 4 - 6 years or BS with 6 - 8 years Laboratory bench experience preparing bioconjugates, modified polymeric surfaces, and immunoassay experience are highly desirable. Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to apply statistical methods to design experiments and evaluate results. Agility Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently and cooperatively as part of a team Organizational skills and ability to plan work. I nitiative and accountab ility (ownership); ability to focus on task at hand; detail oriented. Ability to adapt to changes in timelines, priorities , and other unexpected circumstances. Ability to work well under pressure and handle stress. Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters.
