The R&D Product Systems Engineering & Integration team is looking for a strong Systems Engineer to join a group of 1 6 engineers and scientists focused on characterizing diagnostic products as they are integrated into instrument systems.  As a Product Systems Engineer, you will functionally break down, characterize, and model both assay and instrument components and processes to understand the relationship bet ween key inputs and outputs to help develop products within an overall integrated system, ensuring that end products meet requirements and perform their intended functions. What Can You Expect You will collaboratively develop and support world class diagnostic assays that provide customer satisfaction through successful implementation on our instrument platforms by optimizing and verifying performance metrics including, accuracy, precision, run success rate, as well as the time it takes our instruments to produce results, evidenced by acceptable customer satisfaction metrics. Products are developed and supported within an overall integrated system framework encompassing a complete range of sciences, engineering, manufacturing, marketing and customer support inputs to ensure end products meet requirements and perform their intended functions. The successful candidate will collaborate with different technical areas ( including biochemistry, electrical/ mechanical engineering, software engineering, assay development) to perform design and investigation activities with well-designed experiments and by conducting system modeling, characterizations, data analysis, simulation, designing and implementing solutions. Strong participation and collaboration in diverse project teams to support development and investigation activities by performing well-designed experiments, conducting data analysis and presenting findings. Work cross-functionally to consider full spectrum of relevant aspects of product development and design. Develop and implement novel test methods for assuring system function in nominal and marginal operating conditions. Gather internal and external data, carries out analyses and reaches conclusions.  Provide support for overall system throughout entire product development process, including consultative support and ensuring each system piece is progressing and integrated according to plan. Conceptualize and evaluate technical feasibility of new product concepts and major hardware changes to existing products.  Document experiments and other lab or production activities.  Prepares reports and summaries. Presents results and conclusions.  Maintains appropriate records. Maintain knowledge of products and procedures, developments in the field , industry and regulatory environment s .  Adheres to appropriate procedures and regulatory requirements. May participate in conferences, webinars and seminars to continue to develop knowledge base . What Do You Need To Succeed EDUCATION: Bachelor’s or Preferably a Master’s or P h D in Engineering, Biology, Chemistry or related field EXPERIENCE : Preferably 7+ years of applicable experience. Required Skills And Abilities Systems Modeling Capability to create descriptive, predictive, functional, and other models using modeling related software of your preference ( R, JMP, COMSOL, Mathematica, MATLAB, MathCAD , Python, etc.). Characterizes and models systems by breaking them down into their component parts, mapping out how each function will work within the overall system to ensure products will operate to requirements and as intended. Capability to research and investigate all aspects of a product (engineering, biology and chemistry , etc.) and how they interact to provide technical and experimental recommendations to the project team. Able to gain full understanding of historic processes and models to better understand the current or new systems, and not be constrained within them. Master of using margin and applying it to understand a product ’s performance : r equirements vs c apability , s ensitivity, etc. Statistical Modeling and Communication Strong appreciation for statistical uncertainty and able to define, understand, and model probabilistic statements and conditions. Experience with analyzing data using statistical software, R or JMP highly preferred. Project Capabilities A visionary skeptic: t reats their own ideas with appropriate skepticism. Takes initiative and accountability (shows ownership); focuses on task at hand; detail oriented. Working knowledge of coding preferred (LabVIEW, Lua, Python, Java, etc.). Ability to influence other groups, effective collaboration across varied disciplines. Ability to re-prioritize based on new inputs and discoveries. Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Strong judgement with ability to review all options and choose the most appropriate, with sometimes limited information. Appreciation for process without being limited by it. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present to diverse audiences. Physical Demands Work with exposed moving electro-mechanical parts. Work with exposed electrical power requiring proper protective equipment. jobTitle: Senior Supplier Quality Engineer, Chemicals and Biologicals
jobDescription: As a Senior Supplier Quality Engineer, Biologicals and Chemicals, you will perform engineering activities to identify quality suppliers and parts for IDEXX products. You will act as lead technical interface between IDEXX and supply base, identify Critical to Quality (CTQ) components and production processes necessary for supplier to deliver a quality part and interpret specifications. You will also provide coaching and guidance and ensures suppliers have sufficient processes in place to meet CTQ items, assist suppliers in implementing new processes as needed for compliance, and review and approve supplier quality control plans detailing each step of the manufacturing process. You will also have the ability to apply Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques to CTQ items to ensure part quality. You will work as a team with supplier relationship managers, research & development (R&D) and others, critiques R&D design specifications and other engineering protocols from supplier perspective, arrange R&D/supplier meetings and partners with R&D through to product launches. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance and continuous improvement What You Can Expect In This Role Performs engineering activities to identify quality suppliers and parts for IDEXX products. Acts as technical contact to assigned supplier(s). Responsible to act as a liaison between cross functional teams and external business partners Manages corrective actions as required from supplier 8D’s or non-conformance reports. Lead activities to improve supplier performance Perform Quality Audits for Suppliers Identifies Critical to Quality (CTQ) components and production processes necessary for suppliers to deliver quality parts. Initiates and communicates performance measures to worldwide supply network members. Interprets specifications, provides coaching and guidance, and ensures suppliers have sufficient processes in place to meet CTQ items. Reviews and approves supplier quality control plans detailing each step of the manufacturing process. Develops, implements, and manages incoming quality assurance, sampling plans, inspection tools and custom measurement equipment. Assists suppliers in implementing new processes as needed for compliance. Manage part or product quotations, process definition and development, custom tooling costing/scheduling/implementation and production startup ending in supplier qualifications to self-developed schedules. Develops and implements the documentation, process operations and qualification steps that support supplier production operations. Performs day to day problem solving and debugging using Six Sigma tools and methodologies. Define, analyze, and implement part and end product transfers. Applies Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques to CTQ items to ensure part quality. Provides product data (specifications, drawings, bills of materials, testing requirements, etc.) to the supplier for purposes of review prior to the implementation of a Change Order (CO) ensuring that suppliers are in the CO review process and capable of adhering to the required CTQ’s. Develops strong business relationships and works in teams with supplier relationship managers, research & development (R&D) and others. Leads supplier process assessments for new and existing suppliers. Critiques R&D design specifications and other engineering protocols from supplier perspective, arranges R&D/supplier meetings and partners with R&D through to product launches. Provides leadership with internal R&D engineering for supplier and part/product qualification and change management during the part and product definition, development, prototyping, pilot production and design verification process. Responsible for part and product introduction. What You Will Need To Succeed You have a BS in Engineering (Chemical or Biological experience preferred) Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions. Ability to work with mathematical concepts. Ability to calculate production cycle time, labor standard, efficiency/effectively/utilization and staffing models. Ability to generate, interpret, and explain with clarity, complex mechanical design drawings and documentation. Ability to adapt formal problem-solving methodology to fit the situation discovered. Mastery of or capable to perform engineering and non-engineering applications. Project leadership/management skills. Production assembly and test process flow design and implementation. Product and process control skills Must be able to perform well both autonomously and in leading teams. 20% travel is required (domestic and international). Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. Every role at IDEXX contributes to enhancing the health and wellbeing of pets, people, and livestock. With over 10,000 global team members, customers in over 175 countries, and a fast-growing industry - we’re always looking for motivated and inspiring people to join us. We offer competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

As a Telecommunications Analyst , you will work with our business partners, consult, gather requirements, design and implement solutions using a suite of Contact Center software tools. You will create menus, call flows and integrations to other systems. You will troubleshoot and support multiple phone systems and Contact Center suites at IDEXX locations worldwide. This is a 100% virtual role. We are the Global Telecommunications and AudioVisual team. Our mission is to provide a professional customer-focused, single point of contact for Contact Center support and advice within our big IDEXX family. We strive to deliver exceptional customer service and support 3 Contact Center suites (Avaya, Genesys Connect, Genesys Cloud), 270 Video Conference units and Cisco WebEx across 100+ IDEXX locations around the world. Most of the team works virtually in the US and we have two Telecom Analysts working virtually in Europe. In This Role You will assess and optimize telecommunications systems. You will collaborate with users and create telephony solutions to meet the needs of our business and customers. You will monitor day-to-day operation of telephone and related equipment, assisting in responding to user repairs and problems. You will assist with maintaining “zero downtime” for telephone and related equipment. You will analyze, evaluate and recommend additions, improvements and changes to the telecommunications voice network. You will supervise installation of software and network services. You will be on call 24x7 one week every 5 weeks (Monday – Sunday). What does Success Look Like? Day 1 – You are enthusiastic, willing to understand the role and absorb the content and eagerly jump in. Day 30 – You have general understanding of IDEXX telecoms infrastructure. Day 90 – You are independently working with the business on gathering the requirements and developing call flows and contact center process. Day 365 – You are recommending improvements and changes - experience to improve. What You Will Need to Succeed? You have Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent combination of education and work experience required. You have 5+ years’ experience with: Contact Center leaders to create menus and call flows for Omni Channel interactions (Phone, Email, Chat…). Contact Center reporting, voice analyzer and workforce management tools. Integration to other platforms – Salesforce, other PBX’s. Cloud based platform (preferably Genesys Cloud) for a global company with over 1,000 agents. You worked in international environment. You have strong knowledge of Microsoft environment. You are good at organizing your work and managing time. You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. You are a strong communicator both in writing and verbally. You are fluent in English and can hear English across multiple accents. Knowledge of other languages will be an advantage. You are able to work in stressful situations with flexible hours. Your internet connection is strong and reliable. You are prepared to travel from time to time. Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. As a ServiceNow Analyst, you are part of the Global HR Technology Team responsible for the analysis, design, and development of mainly ServiceNow along with Workday. While working closely with all HR CoEs globally, you will build a thorough understanding of HR business processes, analyze the evolving business requirements to configure the development of business solutions, improve the systems we support, and look into creating efficiency within the different departments through Robotic Process Automation (RPA) work The Department The Global HR Technology team consist of 6 committed professionals based in the US and Europe. Being an integral member of this team, which has been growing with IDEXX all along the way, you will share the vision of taking ownership of your functional expertise area and be ready to collaborate and support your peers. We perform as a united team, no country silos! In This Role You will be mainly responsible for ServiceNow system design, configuration, and setup. This is a technical position where you would be administering enhancements and updates to the HR Service Delivery product. This position will configure key functional areas of the Workday system. ServiceNow HR Service Delivery You will administer ServiceNow configuration, services, and perform related maintenance tasks You will Identify system deficiencies and recommend solutions You will participate in ongoing production and end user support You will Liaise with stakeholders and IT, to contribute to ServiceNow governance and continual improvement. Workday You will manage Workday system configuration. You will analyze and troubleshoot Workday related issues through root-cause analysis and resolve. You will assist in the day-to-day maintenance and support of Workday operations. What You Will Need To Succeed You hold a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. You have at least 2 years of HR systems experience (ServiceNow experience preferred). You are analytical and have strong problem-solving skills. You are detail oriented with high degree of accuracy. You are able to prioritize tasks with tight deadlines. You are comfortable working both individually and as a team player. You are a strong communicator, both verbal and written. You are able to drive conversations What We Offer When you join IDEXX, you will find yourself in a challenging but exciting environment where you are given the opportunity to be yourself, innovate, and grow. We have so much to offer! From day one, you will get full autonomy in your work and ample support when you need it. You will join a successful team who is proud of the work they do and motivated by their unified purpose of helping others. You will work with people who are inspiring, open, and the best in their operating space. We believe in you – with over 10,000 employees all over the globe, there are lots of opportunities for learning, personal growth, and career expansion. You’ll be part of a double-digit growth company in a quickly growing market and we are leading the way forward with innovative products, services, and a strong focus on our customers. IDEXX seeks a Software Engineer II - Embedded ( telecommuting permitted to IDEXX worksite in Westbrook, Maine.) The Software Engineer II - Embedded designs embedded software that controls operations of electromechanical subsystems in company products, manages test results, provides user interfaces for these products and enables their connectivity with other related systems; develops real-time embedded programs to control motion-enabled subsystems, allowing these to move and perform various mechanical functions necessary to achieve their purpose of design; creates designs, configures and codes programs to the design specifications; and develops, designs, implements and tests algorithms to enable required functions to be performed, taking into account mechanical limitations, system constraints, workflow requirements and other variables. The Software Engineer II – Embedded utilizes strong C and C++ skills to build applications and/or device drivers, in a Linux environment, that allow user operation and control of the machines; has the ability to work on a cross functional team and communicate complex ideas in a concise manner to non-technical team members; has the ability to distill general requirements, enhancement requests and defect reports from non-technical team members and incorporate those into product software; designs and develops tools or applications which allow efficient processing of large datasets for visualization and interpretation, estimating errors, statistical analysis and examining correlations, troubleshooting system behavior and testing algorithm changes or improvements; tests final products to specifications and ensures that quality requirements are met; coordinates with development project teams, in an agile work environment, from design phase through to prototype development and production release; participates in the development of new product requirements, features and design; evaluates field performance of existing software and systems and troubleshoots any problems by investigating root cause of software-related problems, diagnosing faults and reverse-engineering existing code; specifies, implements and tests modifications to existing software; and creates design, release and other related software/system documentation, utilizing vendor-supplied documentation as needed. What You Need To Succeed Requires Master’s in Computer Science, Embedded Systems Engineering or a related field and 1 year prior experience as a software engineer designing embedded software that controls operations of electromechanical subsystems, or, alternatively, a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Embedded Systems Engineering or a related field and 3 years prior experience as a software engineer designing embedded software that controls operations of electromechanical subsystems. All qualified candidates must have at least some direct experience with each of the following work activities/skills: embedded Linux projects and either Microcontrollers or Linux Kernel Drivers. IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. seeks a Software Test Lead in Westbrook, ME. The Software Test Lead develops and executes software test strategies to identify software problems and their causes. Specific core duties and responsibilities include developing and executing formal plans, procedures and scenarios for manual and automated software testing to ensure quality of software applications; designing and developing the test strategy for product changes in collaboration with the software development and product owner team members; performing smoke, application, functional and regression testing of software applications, including determining the appropriate level of testing to ensure that systems or applications are tested effectively prior to implementation; planning software tests, writing test cases/scripts, automating test cases and executing tests; documenting and tracking software test results, defects and other quality metrics; developing and implementing software test quality standards and best practices, contributing ideas and effort toward continuous improvement of software testing; and delivering quality process training to technical staff and acting as an internal quality consultant for software quality assurance. Position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Applications, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field; 5 years of experience; and the following proficiencies/skills: testing techniques used in Iterative and Agile projects; testing all facets of software application functions and operation; HP Quality Center, Selenium, or Test Complete; automated testing using HP Quick Test Professional, Test Complete, The Grinder, or other automation tools; and Basic SQL allowing for efficient data validation; Salesforce, contacts management, opportunities and lead management, Quote to Order processing, and integration testing with SAP. This position is based at IDEXX’s headquarters in Westbrook, Maine, with the option to telecommute within a normal commuting distance from home approximately two days per week. jobTitle: Sr Back End Developer-Global Web Strategy
jobDescription: The Global Online Experience Team at IDEXX seeks a talented and driven Sr. Back-End Developer, to bring engaging digital solutions to life for our worldwide audience of veterinary customers. As Sr. Back-End Developer at IDEXX, you'll be responsible for the server side code and APIs of our customer facing marketing sites and platforms, including idexx.com. You Will be involved in the entire product development lifecycle including design, development, deployment and maintenance of new and existing features. Your work will impact the stability and quality of our global web applications. write reusable and maintainable code. conduct UI tests to optimize performance. manage queues of web development work associated with optimizing, improving and standardizing back-end website experiences for online audiences. deploy code changes to production environments using version control software (e.g. GitHub) and best practices for clean, sustainable and scalable code. troubleshoot bugs and code issues to identify areas of improvement by compiling and analyzing data. support several platform integration projects, such as Docebo Learning with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or our used DAM (Widen) with our future CMS. be responsible for our Google Tag Manager, by making sure tags are fired properly, and that best practices are followed. work closely with designers, our Front-end developer, UX specialist, Web Producers, IT teams and leadership to ensure system consistency and to create a great user experience. be a key stakeholder is the next re-platforming and transformation projects. participate in continuing education and training to remain current on best practices. Reporting to the Manager, Global Web Strategy for IDEXX, you'll be the driving force behind all global back-end activities. What You Need To Succeed Experience with programming languages like Java, Ruby, PHP or Python (preferably with django CMS and Drupal). Good understanding of the entire product development process. Experience working with Amazon Web Services. Familiarity with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG international standard, including WCAG 2.0, WCAG 2.1, and WCAG 2.2). Basic knowledge of front-end technologies like HTML, JavaScript and CSS is desired, but not necessary. Basic knowledge of technical SEO. Both technical and consumer awareness. Ability to troubleshoot problems in the team and for our partners. You're analytical and good at time management. You are great at problem-solving and work well in a small (distributed on several time zones) team. You are independent and proactive (this is a virtual role). You're curious about new technologies and you're excited to find ways to implement them in your work. You can oversee and drive projects forward. You have experience representing the company while working with vendors and freelancers. If this describes you, we want to meet you! If you are enthusiastic about doing high quality work within a global digital marketing center of excellence, please apply today. As a Supply Chain Associate in IDEXX's Westbrook distribution center, you may perform a variety of tasks including receiving our products, and pick, pack, load, and shipping of our products to national customers and distribution centers. You will ensure accuracy of documentation and shipments, troubleshoot and resolve issues as required while maintaining a clean, orderly, and safe warehouse and environment. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. Schedule This is a full-time, 2nd shift position, Monday-Friday 3pm-11:30pm. Primary Duties And Responsibilities May be responsible for any or all of the following: Picks, packs, loads and ships products to national and international customers and distribution centers Prepares documentation and products, ensures accuracy of documentation and shipments, and troubleshoots and resolves issues as required Assists with or coordinates international shipping ; reviews, reconciles and approves all incoming international vendor bills Maintains a clean, orderly and safe warehouse and environment Investigates and resolves inventory inaccuracies and provides root cause analysis and recommendations for corrective actions Supports inventory processes, solutions and strategies for the continuous improvement of inventory accuracy and order fulfillment quality; includes cycle counts, data entry, tracking, reconciling, documenting and reporting Moves and stores equipment, raw materials and inventory for internal and external customers Supports instrument repair process including daily and routine shipping and receiving; tracks incoming and repaired materials, assuring system and operational readiness for the repair of instruments Administers instrument repair and field replacement programs, coordinates all failure analysis and reports, issues periodic reports on outstanding deliveries for inbound and outbound units, and coordinates all field returns, worldwide Education High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Associates degree or equivalent preferred. Required Skills And Abilities Ability to work well under pressure and tight time constraints Ability to effectively function in a team environment Ability to prioritize work and handle multiple tasks simultaneously Good computer skills and knowledge including SAP, Microsoft Word and Excel preferred Excellent customer service skills Ability to work flexible hours Able to follow all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and applicable ISO regulations Able to properly lift up to 70 pounds; ability to move up to 100 pounds with assistance For distribution and material handling work: Certificate to operate a forklift may be required; certificate to work with hazardous materials may be required; knowledge of export documentation and international traffic may be required; previous experience with dangerous goods is preferred; knowledge of customs rules, regulations and export documentation preferred Physical Demands Warehouse-type environment Ability to lift 50lbs. Work Environment Normal warehouse environment where protective clothing may be required Moderate to high noise level While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and can be exposed to risk of electrical shock. We receive thousands of clinical samples every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. As a temporary Sample Management Technician , (SMT), also referred to as a Specimen Processor or Specimen Accessioner; you'd be helping to sort, tag, and prepare the samples for testing. The samples that we work with are blood, urine, fecal samples, and biopsies that we receive from the vet clinics (no animals on-site!) Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role You will receive, prepare, and accession veterinary samples (blood, urine, feces, and biopsies) for laboratory analysis and testing. You can expect to remove specimens from transport bags and enter specimen data into a computer tracking system. You will rack and bundle prepared samples for delivery to each testing department. You will assist other lab personnel with specimen storage and ensuring that Turn Around Times (TAT's) are met.   From day one, you'll have full autonomy in your work, but you'll also get full support when you need it. You will play a critical role as part of a successful team that is proud of the work they do and motivated by the common purpose in helping veterinarians quickly diagnose illness and disease in pets and animals. What You Will Need To Succeed You have a positive attitude and love to bring this energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues, whether working independently or as a team contributor. You are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume work environment. You value working at the highest levels of accuracy, safety, and quality You are able to read, understand and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), including safety and quality procedures. You have a familiarity and comfort with using computers for data entry. You are able to prioritize and multi-task, demonstrate excellent attention to detail on the job, and can work reliably and precisely Your customer service skills are top-notch Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a part time, Monday-Friday position, 12pm-5:30pm The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. This position has the potential to lead to a permanent role at IDEXX Pay The starting rate of pay for this position is $17.00/hr Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? As a Temporary Veterinary Laboratory Technician at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive pay and day one benefits. IDEXX reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. Want to learn more about working at IDEXX? Hear what our current employees have to say in the videos below: https://vimeo.com/663393928 - Why I chose IDEXX - Timothy McElroy, IDEXX Medical Laboratory Tech https://vimeo.com/662998695 - The Best Part About Patient Sample Management - Taylor Gardner, IDEXX Tech https://vimeo.com/662998583 - The Best Part about Parasitology - Stephanie McAdam, Medical Laboratory Technician In This Role You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes, and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries, and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment.  You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal, or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in one or more of the following areas:   Hematology: Testing cell-related components of blood samples to enumerate and identify their cellular components, including the microscopic evaluation of blood smears and the use of automated and manual counting techniques.   Chemistry/Endocrinology: Testing blood and body fluids for various analytes, utilizing automated instrumentation. Urinalysis: Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques.     Cytology: Processing blood and body fluids for microscopic examination by pathologists. Includes slide preparation and staining, utilizing manual and automated counting techniques. Immunology/Serology: Testing blood and other samples for the presence of viral and bacterial disease by detecting antibodies (AB) or antigens (AG).  Parasitology: Examining samples to identify parasites, utilizing fecal flotation and various microscopic techniques. PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) : Examining samples for the presence of specific substances (often bacteria) using molecular diagnostic methods. What You Will Need To Succeed You are able to work nights Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a full-time (40 hr/wk), NIGHT SHIFT position. Monday-Friday 11:30pm-8:00am, may have rotating weeekends The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. PAY: $23/hr Why IDEXX? We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? As a temporary Laboratory Assistant at IDEXX, you will be assisting with some of the many tasks vital to the running of our network of Reference Labs. We receive thousands of clinical samples (blood, urine, fecal samples) every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. In this role, you will be helping to sort, tag, and prepare veterinary samples for testing. Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why the pet might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? IDEXX Reference Laboratories are a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise, while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role, Responsibilities Will Vary Currently, our greatest need is in our Parasitology Department. This is the area of the lab where fecal samples are tested. You might be unbagging, sorting, tagging, or moving clinical samples around the laboratory. You may be restocking supplies, such as chemicals or slide trays. You could be helping to load analyzers with slides of samples. You might be assisting with inventory counts. You will be asked to help out in many ways – and your help is needed! Want to learn more about temp positions in our Parasitology Department? Check out what our employees have to say: Why Parasitology is Important to IDEXX with Ashley Lemley, Labs Manager What You Need to Succeed in Parasitology with Timothy Ives, Lab Supervisor The Best Part About Working in Parasitology - Stephanie McAdam, Medical Laboratory Technician Want to see more videos about working in our lab? Check out these videos: https://vimeo.com/idexxcareers Pay & Schedule Hourly rates targeting: $20 This is a long-term temporary position where you will be working 35 hours per week. The scheduled shifts will likely have a start time of 1:30am , and the shift would end at 8:30am ET , depending on your start time. The flexibility to stay longer as needed is a huge plus. Weekend Rotations are required. So, one week, you'll work Monday through Friday nights with Saturday and Sunday off; the next week, you'll work 4 weeknights plus Saturday night into Sunday morning, and have one night off during the week and Sunday night. Saturday hours are 1:30am-8:30am The shifts and hours may vary slightly depending on business needs. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. What You Will Need To Succeed You are able and willing to work the schedule above on the overnight shift. You are reliable and flexible – attendance is an essential function of the position. A willingness to work with and around veterinary samples, including blood, urine, fecals and biopsies. You are excited to work in a fast-paced, high volume busy work environment. You are able to sit or stand for long periods of time; you do not mind being on your feet and moving throughout the night as needed. You can read and interpret documents such as safety rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), material safety data sheets (MSDSs), operating and maintenance instructions, government rules, and technical procedures. You must have a demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task. You possess strong initiative and follow through with outstanding attention to detail. You are able to work independently and as a team contributor. You have demonstrated a high level of customer service. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, ability to move or maneuver through various departments around the lab, use of hands, fingers, and arms to handle microscopes, pipettes, lab instruments and controls, occasional need to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, lift up to 25lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Why IDEXX? 100% Remote for Anyone based in the US About IDEXX Veterinary Software IDEXX Veterinary Software is the fastest growing part of IDEXX, with technology platforms that help veterinary practices run their businesses.  If you are in the veterinary world, you know that IDEXX is a global leader in pet healthcare innovation – with diagnostic, software, and data solutions for practicing veterinarians around the world.  If you are a pet owner and have ever visited your local veterinary clinic there is a really good chance that your practitioner was leveraging our software, diagnostic equipment or reference labs. If you are not a pet owner, that’s OK; we would still love to hear from you! About The Job We are looking for a Test Automation Engineer for our Data Integration Squad. The primary mission of our integration squad is to connect practice management data to all of the downstream people and systems that can use it to contribute to better results for our pets. Our stack is fairly heterogenous in that we have applications written in Java, .Net and a number of other technologies. We are deployed directly in clinics as well as in the cloud.  We leverage PaaS capabilities on both AWS and Azure to get the job done.  Our engineers are experienced, dedicated, diverse and extremely clever.  Lastly, while we have the backing of an international organization in IDEXX, we operate fairly autonomously, more like a startup.  We are looking for someone who can both enhance existing solutions and develop greenfield offerings on behalf of our product partners. Anyway, it’s a pretty cool space.  In This Role You will develop and execute formal plans, procedures and scenarios for manual and automated testing to ensure quality of software applications. You will develop test automation and tooling. You will deliver documents and track test results, defects, and other quality metrics. Enters problems and issues into system and participates in resolution. You will develop and implement quality standards and best practices, contributing ideas and effort toward continuous improvement. You will deliver quality process training to technical staff and acts as an internal quality consultant to advise or influence business or technical partners. What You Will Need To Succeed You are experienced in one or more programming languages, preferably C# or Java. You are fanatic about quality and can write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests. You have tested and consumed REST APIs. You are familiar with Continuous Integration (CI) concepts and Continuous Delivery and Deployment.

jobTitle: Veterinary Laboratory Assistant - Temporary, Night Shift
jobDescription: We receive thousands of clinical samples every day from Veterinary Clinics, and we run tests on those samples to help veterinarians identify what might be wrong with someone's pet. As a Laboratory Assistant/Specimen Processor, you'd be helping to sort, tag, and prepare the samples for testing. Also may assist lab technicians with a variety of duties to assist in processing samples. The samples that we work with are blood, urine, fecal samples, and biopsies that we receive from the vet clinics (no animals on-site!) Every sample you help to move along quickly and accurately in the process means we are one step closer to finding out how or why they might be sick. Thanks to you, someone's very beloved pet will get the treatment plan they need - how great is that? IDEXX Reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role You will receive, prepare, and accession veterinary samples (blood, urine, feces, and biopsies) for laboratory analysis and testing. You can expect to remove specimens from transport bags and enter specimen data into a computer tracking system. You will rack and bundle prepared samples for delivery to each testing department. You will assist other lab personnel with specimen storage and ensuring that Turn Around Times (TAT's) are met.   From day one, you'll have full autonomy in your work, but you'll also get full support when you need it. You will play a critical role as part of a successful team that is proud of the work they do and motivated by the common purpose of helping veterinarians quickly diagnose illness and disease in pets and animals. What You Need To Succeed You are able to work nights You have a positive attitude and love to bring this energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues, whether working independently or as a team contributor. You are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume work environment. You value working at the highest levels of accuracy, safety, and quality You are able to read, understand, and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's), including safety and quality procedures. You have a familiarity and comfort with using computers for data entry. You are able to prioritize and multi-task, demonstrated excellent attention to detail on the job, and can work reliably and precisely Your customer service skills are top-notch Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule:  This is a full-time (40hrs) Third shift, with full-time weekly hours Monday - Friday: 11:30 PM - 8:00 AM, and rotating every 3rd Saturday 4:00 PM - 12:30 AM. Reliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of this position. Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? As a Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) in the field of urinalysis at IDEXX, you will be a key contributor at one of the largest veterinary diagnostic companies in the world. You will perform laboratory testing that helps veterinarians diagnose and treat pets. You will join a fast-paced work environment that encourages teamwork, quality, and offers opportunities for personal growth. This is a full-time role with competitive benefits and shift differential.   IDEXX Reference laboratories is a global network united by a shared commitment to enhancing pet care where the true strength in our name is the people behind it. Our reference laboratories make it possible for our customers to discover more with our unrelenting commitment to innovation, personalized support, guidance, and expertise while providing the most complete and advanced menu of diagnostic tests along with technology and tools. In This Role You will be using automated analyzers, microscopes and other laboratory diagnostic tools to perform analyses and tests that diagnose animal illnesses, injuries and diseases in support of veterinarian animal treatment.  You will be performing diagnostic tests on blood, urine, fecal or pet biopsy samples that we receive in our lab by the thousands, every day. You will be responsible for setting up and running lab tests and reading and releasing results according to SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures). You can expect to specialize in the following area:   Urinalysis : Analysis and evaluation of chemical and microscopic components of urine samples, using automated instrumentation and manual techniques.   What You Will Need To Succeed Ideally, you will have experience working in a laboratory. Experience setting up, running and reading lab test and operating laboratory equipment (microscopes and/or clinical diagnostic analyzers) would be a plus. You have a positive attitude and love to bring that energy into the lab every day to support your colleagues You are looking forward to working in a team You concentrate on the details and can work reliably and precisely You have a great sense of team spirit and responsibility You possess a High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. A 2-, 3- or 4-year degree in a Science-related field is preferred. Need local requirements It is not required to work in our lab, but if you were a Veterinary Technician (RVT, LVT, CVT) or Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT or MT), this experience and education would be a plus. Able to meet the physical requirements that go with working in a lab – standing and sitting for extended periods of time, phone & computer use, extended reach, lifting up to 50lb, and specific vision ability – close, color, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. This is a laboratory, so there is potential exposure to biohazards, agents known to cause zoonotic diseases, and hazardous chemicals. Schedule This is a full time (40 hr / wk ), third shift position with hours Tuesday through Saturday, 1:00am-9:30am . R eliable and dependable attendance is an essential function of the position. We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. seeks a Virtual Clinical Pathologist (telecommuting permitted to IDEXX West Sacramento, CA worksite). The Virtual Clinical Pathologist is responsible for the examination of digitally scanned clinical pathology veterinary specimens in order to provide veterinary clients with diagnostic evaluations, as well as any necessary follow-up consultation. Virtual Clinical Pathologists provide reference laboratory testing and consulting services to veterinarians and veterinary practices and do not treat patients or provide direct patient care. The job duties include providing high-quality reports and work tasks in accordance with best practices and the highest standards; completing tasks with proficiency and skill, meeting and occasionally exceeding expectations for quantity and TAT in veterinary diagnostic pathology, education, research, customer-focus and/or project work.The Virtual Clinical Pathologist provides direct support for veterinarians, who use IDEXX reference laboratory services by submitting samples to the reference laboratory facility, which offers a range of tests and diagnostic panels to detect disease states and other conditions in animals, including specialized and proprietary tests developed by IDEXX to diagnose diseases and conditions in dogs and cats, including parasites, heart disease, allergies, pancreatitis, diabetes, and infectious diseases. The Virtual Clinical Pathologist attends regular Continuing Education and shares knowledge with others to improve outcomes and is an active participant in teams meetings/rounds or committees within the pathology department. The minimum requirements for the position of Clinical Pathologist are a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree or foreign equivalent and board certification by the American College of Veterinary Pathologists in the specialty of clinical pathology. Applicants may apply online at https://careers.idexx.com/us/en/ or e-mail hireme@idexx.com . As a Supply Chain Associate in IDEXX's Westbrook distribution center, you may perform a variety of tasks including receiving our products, and pick, pack, load, and shipping of our products to national customers and distribution centers. You will ensure accuracy of documentation and shipments, troubleshoot and resolve issues as required while maintaining a clean, orderly, and safe warehouse and environment. Exceeding customer expectations is one of our guiding principles at IDEXX. Our credibility as a company relies on our ability to deliver quality products to our customers on time and with no disruption to their business. IDEXX’s Worldwide Operations Team works to meet this challenge each day with a global network of distribution hubs and a focus on efficiency, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement. Schedule This is a full-time, 1st shift position, Monday-Friday 8:30am-5pm. Primary Duties And Responsibilities May be responsible for any or all of the following: Picks, packs, loads and ships products to national and international customers and distribution centers Prepares documentation and products, ensures accuracy of documentation and shipments, and troubleshoots and resolves issues as required Assists with or coordinates international shipping ; reviews, reconciles and approves all incoming international vendor bills Maintains a clean, orderly and safe warehouse and environment Investigates and resolves inventory inaccuracies and provides root cause analysis and recommendations for corrective actions Supports inventory processes, solutions and strategies for the continuous improvement of inventory accuracy and order fulfillment quality; includes cycle counts, data entry, tracking, reconciling, documenting and reporting Moves and stores equipment, raw materials and inventory for internal and external customers Supports instrument repair process including daily and routine shipping and receiving; tracks incoming and repaired materials, assuring system and operational readiness for the repair of instruments Administers instrument repair and field replacement programs, coordinates all failure analysis and reports, issues periodic reports on outstanding deliveries for inbound and outbound units, and coordinates all field returns, worldwide Education High School diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Associates degree or equivalent preferred. Required Skills And Abilities Ability to work well under pressure and tight time constraints Ability to effectively function in a team environment Ability to prioritize work and handle multiple tasks simultaneously Good computer skills and knowledge including SAP, Microsoft Word and Excel preferred Excellent customer service skills Ability to work flexible hours Able to follow all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and applicable ISO regulations Able to properly lift up to 70 pounds; ability to move up to 100 pounds with assistance For distribution and material handling work: Certificate to operate a forklift may be required; certificate to work with hazardous materials may be required; knowledge of export documentation and international traffic may be required; previous experience with dangerous goods is preferred; knowledge of customs rules, regulations and export documentation preferred Physical Demands Warehouse-type environment Ability to lift 50lbs. Work Environment Normal warehouse environment where protective clothing may be required Moderate to high noise level While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and can be exposed to risk of electrical shock. The Global Online Experience Team at IDEXX seeks a talented and driven Senior Web Strategist/Product Owner, to lead our global website strategy efforts.
